title: Seeking a Connection
text:
Hi there,

My attempt to reach out to folks that are in a similar boat for a platonic and intellectual journey. If you get it, no more words needed. Ernest Hemingway said "It is good to have an end to journey toward; but it is the journey that matters, in the end." which imbibes the spirit of this. ad. This is not an ad for seeking an affair or escape but affection of the mind, spirit and meaning while we try do our best in our walks of life. A connection, confidant, friend. Blessed are those who can derive the whole from what they have going, in my case I am seeking and offering a platform to complement our well being. Reasons might be many what folks experience and go through, but if goal of fortifying our minds and life experiences is noble, the journey takes on meaning to get to a better place. Genuine ad by a real person hoping to connect with a kindred soul, I am attached and fully comprehend the meaning of platonic. At this point, now that you have labored thru the posting, either you conclude this is too esoteric or might have piqued your interest for a further chat. Drop me an email to find out. I am intentionally refraining from a verbose bio about myself as they are less important than the words above, suffice it to say I am a 38 yr old sane aka full possession of my faculties (LOL) well settled and well balanced gent. title: I Am Really Not Sure What I Want ?
text:
Not Sure What I Want ?

I have posted on CL before . . .

I am just not sure what I want, are you ?

I have posted for just romance and nothing else and got some responses, but nothing worked out.

I have been tempted to answer, in fact I have, some of the posts for FWB and Let's DO IT not sure what to expect ?

That was an even bigger failure than the Romance Post plan.

Let me say that I AM married, that will never change for reasons I will not get into right away. Life can be complicated and sometimes you have to fulfill your obligations even if it means enormous compromise.

But at the same time, if I cannot live life and be me . . . then I am cheating myself and everyone around me. I know this sounds very selfish and self centered. Sorry I have to still live and breathe and see the world around me.

There is alot I desire, there is alot I miss, there is so much I want to experience again, and yet I know I must just be patient and take things very, very slow.

I have had a few things happen in my life that brought me to this place and if I found someone who truly wanted to know I would share some of this.

So where do we draw the line ? What is OK and what is not ?

I am also not vanilla ice cream by any stretch of the imagination, not that this may come into play with whatever may come from this,

What that means, and it is a very wide ranging topic, is that I crave passion and kissing and more, but NOT the typical Craigslist Quick Hook Up, in fact I am not sure fucking will be a part of this, although there are so many things I do crave and wish to explore with another who, like me, knows there is more and either is aware or not sure that more is or means.. I will just have to hope that YOU, if there is a YOU out there get this . . . even if only conceptually.

The only way you are still reading this is if you are feeling some commonality or curiosity. This will not be tame, but it is not about anything to be afraid of either, in fact what we crave is excitement beyond the simple that most are satisfied with.

I am not a simple person, even though what I think that I want is quite simple. If you are easily embarrassed or offended this may not be for you, since I want to push things to the very edge, but only out here in the safety of cyber-space at first. So there is very little to fear or worry about.

I know I have not been very clear in what I am looking for or what I want, thus the title, remember the subject line of this post ?

I am hoping you partially get it and have been wondering the same thing about yourself, or are after reading this.

So if you feel the same reply NOW, please put " I am not sure either " in your subject line so I know it is a sincere reply

Then you better buckle up, cause it may be a very wild ride, if we do it right ?

OH yes I really would like to know who I am talking to, I hate to do this it is so shallow, but I really have a thing about eyes and I need all the rest too, I read people and your detailed description of you will help me hear you and feel you.

A couple of things, you should be over 18, but beyond that your age is meaningless to me. I prefer a woman who is shaped like a woman, this does not mean you have to be a Barbie Doll, but you have to be somewhat smaller in the middle that the top and bottom and I apologize if this is not you, but it is what works for me. Just to be clear BBW won't work for me, sorry to be blunt. You need to live in the DFW area, if you are outside the area, this is an exercise in futility, unless you travel here OFTEN or something like that.

So are you the ONE that read this whole post and "get's it" if so . . . . ANSWER ME NOW . . . . RIGHT NOW . . . . IMMEDIATELY . . . . Please !

Tell me "I am not sure either" write to me, talk to me, email me, Hurry, I am waiting for YOU !

title: Need an active/fit mentor
text:
I'm ashamed but have to admit that I have really let myself go over the years. I have tried to become healthier and more active, but bad habits and a sedentary lifestyle has severely weakened my will power. I need a mentor/friend to help me change this.

I know "that only I can really make the difference/decision to change" and normally I would agree with this statement as I follow it with almost everything else in my life, but for some reason this one plagues me. I really need help, not just motivation.

I need someone that can show me good habits and be there to enforce them. Someone that is currently active, fit and around my age. I have tried with family members and other friends, but they just do not understand that I need this to be a complete lifestyle change with daily interaction and accountability.

To not only show me how to eat better and what to buy, but also how much to buy. Often I will buy all this great stuff and then just get overwhelmed and then let it rot in the fridge because fast food is easier. I need someone that can push me physically and just get out of the house. Hell, I'd even be willing to pay for this kind of daily help.

I know to some this may sound pathetic and in a way I guess it is. But that's why I'm here asking for help and if you cannot get past that, please just move on. I do not need or want your pity, sarcasm or judgmental remarks. You don't know my story or how I really got this way. Your emails will literally just be ignored and deleted so don't waste your time or mine.

For those who are serious, you'll recognize that this is really just a cry for help. Please send an example of what you would expect our mentor/student/friendship to look like (i.e. routines, meals, activity, etc.) and pictures of you doing activities you really enjoy (I've always wanted to be comfortable to take pictures doing things I love, but always feel too self conscience) so I know you're the kind of person I would want to spend my time with.

I do not know how long this will take or last, but I do that I cannot do this on my own right now. Seriously, please help.

title: Truly Platonic?
text:
The "Strictly Platonic" section is getting pretty bad - just as bad as the casual encounters.

So, is it possible to have a truly platonic friendship? I say it's very difficult if either person has an attraction to the other -- but completely possible.

I don't care if you're married, single, "it's complicated" or something in the middle. I'm a bit of an introvert and enjoy deeper conversations instead of shooting the breeze. To be honest, I enjoy just seeing that email come in and get excited about what the other person has to say.

I've tried this before, but like all craigslist responses, people get what they want out of it and then call it quits or change directions on a dime. That being said - if you're going to respond, don't be an ass and just keep in mind what I'm looking for: conversation. I'm not looking to get in to your pants. If something changes that you don't want to talk anymore, be an adult and say why or at the very least say that you're done talking. It's only the polite thing to do.

Anyway, I hope to hear from someone out there.

Despite that dismal assessment of the status quo, I wouldn't give it up for the world and am not looking to change anything. It is simply that the "play-dates" for the kids aren't cutting it any more as far as social interaction and I can only spend so much time with my co-workers, and even my wife and I hardly have a minute to ourselves. Our conversations have devolved to the point where we don't talk about much else other than the kids and by the time they are in bed at night and we can relax we are just too tired to talk about anything meaningful. This doesn't mean that our marriage is bad, it just means that we are frazzled parents who devote all of our time and energy to the children without regard for our own lives. Most of the people with whom I work are single and much younger than I am, and I really don't want to spend a lunch hour hearing about their drunken exploits. I prefer to meet a woman simply because I have always gotten along better with women and can find more common ground. I am not one of those guys who can only talk about sports or sex and I am also not at the other extreme like a metro-sexual...I am just somewhere in between. title: Will you pretend you're my girlfriend?
text:
Why do I want to meet you?

I want to meet because making that new connection is so intense and exciting and yes even awkward but still delicious. 

I want to meet because when our gazes meet I feel a ferocious rush of possibility. For me to try and deny my attraction and seem unaffected is pointless. My cells all scream. I am reeling. And I want to show you how I feel.

I want to meet because another soul has never had your particular eyes, your shade of skin, tone of voice, your unique scent. No one has ever had your energy and no one ever will and I want to drink it up. 

I want to meet because life is short and I don't want to leave this place someday regretting that I did not reach out to you. I don't want to wonder 'What if I had just been honest about how I feel? Would we have done our dance? Left our mark? Would we have added our play and our joy to the mix?'

I want to meet because there are hidden parts to me. One so tender that wants to show tenderness. One so primal and untamed it wants to make that known to you as well. One so sensual that wants to a awaken your senses. One that thirsts and wants to be intoxicated by your scents and your sounds and your tastes.

I want to meet because I'll admit it: a part of me craves the power to have you in the palm of my hand...quivering, shivering, aching, sweating, longing for bliss, spasming and begging for release. And I would like to grant it.

I want to meet because I'm tired of seeing you without speaking out, without reaching out, without touching, without embracing, without feeling your warmth for a time.

I want to meet even though yes I already have a life and do not want to walk away and destroy it. Still though, life is complicated and this fire inside of me to feel passion and romance won't burn out. The curiosity inside for the unfamiliar and the exotic won't be denied.

title: Free Disney Cruise!
text:
Yeah, that's right. You read that correctly. A free Disney cruise. Go ahead, pinch yourself. You aren't dreaming.

The following is 100% true.

My uncle decided that it was time for a family reunion, but it's hard to get the whole family together for a weekend. So, thinking strategically, he offered to pay everyone's passage on a four-day Disney cruise around the Bahamas.

All of my cousins have already married beautiful spouses and started making beautiful babies, with whom they will be traveling as beautiful little family units. I have no such spouse (or baby), but I still have a +1 ticket that I need to do something with. So. . .hey, Craigslist. You tryna go on a free Disney cruise?

All the haters tell me that you can't find a good travel partner on Craigslist. Those haters clearly don't watch enough Disney movies. Jafar found Aladdin in a prison dungeon. Anna found Sven in some traders' hut in the Norwegian mountains. Rey round the goddamn Millennium Falcon right next to her house, out of all the planets in the entire galaxy. How hard can this really be?

Without making it too easy for internet stalkers to track down my itinerary, the ship embarks in early June. I've got a spare ticket and an extra bed in my berth. Berths aren't that big, but apparently the beds can be separated by about 8 inches, so, you know, everybody saves room for the holy ghost. Point of disembarkation (is this a word?) is Cape Canaveral, so getting there is on you.

If you are legally forbidden from entering the state of Florida, mention that in your application. It's not a deal-breaker; I know a guy.

Obviously, with a free Disney cruise on the line, some sort of selection process is needed. Immediately below are 15 simple questions; if you are in the mood for some Disney Wonder this June, fill this out and send it to me by February 25. Feel free to also submit anything else you think would be relevant to your application: criminal record, Emergency First Responder certification, your photo-collage of that time you led the Main Street Electrical Parade. You know, useful stuff.

Okay, here we go:

Q1: First name?

A1: 

Q2: Age?

A2:

Q3: How many Disney-Pixar films have made you cry?

A3:

Q4: Remember when Disney bought Star Wars? More broadly, are you concerned about the corporate takeover of our government, society, and childhood memories?

A4:

Q5: Disney advertises numerous venues for fun and relaxation on its cruise lines. Indicate how much time you would plan to spend at each of the following venues (i.e. 5%/10%/15% of total cruise time). Don't worry about the math adding up. Estimates are fine.

A5:
Senses Spa & Salon: __%
[Late-night dancing club] Fathoms: __%
[Live piano bar] Keys: __%
The Oceaneer Club: __%
[Tweens club] Edge: __%
["College-dorm-inspired, parents-free. . .where dancing and karaoke are all the rage" Teens club] Vibe: __%
Goofy's Pool: __%
Quiet Cove Pool: __%
AquaDunk, "the exciting drop-out waterslide located high atop the Forward Funnel: __%
"Pirate Night": __%

Q6: What are three things that make you a great travel partner? What is one thing that makes you a bad travel partner?

A6:

Q7: Castaway Cay, Disney's private island in the Bahamas, used to be known as Gorda Cay. It was used almost exclusively as a stopping point in the global drug trade. Now it's Disney's primary vacation spot in the Caribbean. How great is that?

A7:

Q7: Okay, that wasn't really a question. What's your favorite travel experience of your life?

A7:

Q8: Let's imagine we have to create some cover-story so my family doesn't know I picked a travel partner on Craigslist. Propose one such cover-story below:

A8:

Q9: Let's say we hijacked the cruise ship. Where would you go with it?

A9:

Q10: A nuclear holocaust strikes while we are at sea, and the ship's passengers have no choice but to start a post-apocalyptic commune on Castaway Cay. Water-gatherers, lookouts, anti-mutant peacekeepers, the usual stuff. What is your contribution to commune society?

A10:

Q11: What was the single greatest flaw of Christopher Nolan's Inception? What was the greatest strength of Aaron Blaise's Brother Bear?

A11:

Q12: What's the longest interaction you've had with someone who was previously a complete stranger?

A12:

Q13: M. Night Shyamalan and Dan Brown are hired to write the next animated Disney film. Florence Welch is writing the theme song. What's the plot synopsis?

A13:

Q13b: For bonus points, send an MP3 of any segment of the theme song.

Oh man. You're done. Disney splendor is that much closer. The universe envies you. Walt salutes you from his cryogenic chamber. Thanks for participating. I'll get back to you in a minute.

title: Hi from Seattle! Seeking cool email friends, maybe more.
text:
Maybe you've thought about moving to the PNW, or maybe you're just bored and want a new friend to exchange emails with. Whatever the case may be, I'm available for email or chat.

Due to my working a night shift, I pretty much have to resort to trying to meet people online. I have tried to post locally and haven't had very much luck. My theory is that due to living in such an "IT guy" concentrated region, there is huge competition when it comes to meeting women online. Or maybe I'm just not doing it right? Who knows. I've tried OkCupid and that seems even worse.

A little about me...

Being that I live in Seattle, you may have me somewhat figured out. I smoke weed, I drink coffee, I work in technology, and I'm progressive. I have LGBT friends and family. So, we may not mesh well if you're religious or conservative, though I'm open for debating stuff if that's your thing.

I work in IT for a popular retail company. As I mentioned, I work a night shift which leaves me fairly isolated, however I only work 3-4 nights a week, so that's nice because it allows me time to work on music and do other productive things like play video games and watch movies. I like working nights, being awake at night. It's peaceful and sort of like a whole different world. I do stay up until around noon, so it's not like I don't get to see daylight ever, but this schedule does not seem conducive to making new friends.

I play and record guitar, bass, synths, drums, and vocals. I don't have a band right now, but I'm hoping to put one together soon, and I'm hoping that playing my music live will help with meeting people. My music is sort of indie rock with some electronica. My musical tastes range from jazz like Ella Fitzgerald and Miles Davis, to bands like Tool and Radiohead. I was raised on The Beatles, Paul Simon, Billy Joel, Abba, classic rock. One of my favorite 'contemporary' bands is Pinback.

I like getting out and about when I can. There are so many great, beautiful places around Seattle to explore, hike, go camping, etc. I also enjoy traveling when I get the chance. I have been to Canada and Scotland and I'd like to visit many more places, take your pick.

I'm getting back into shape and I feel pretty good about it. I have a home gym where I work out about every other day. I'm also eating healthier; lots of vegetables and fewer carbs/sugar. I'm growing my own garden this year, too, so I'm excited about that.

So, yeah, that's a little about me, now how about you? Feel free to ask me anything, too. I look forward to hearing from you (ʘ‿ʘ)

title: Need a Date for a Party? Event? New in Town? Or Just Bored?
text:
Hi. No. This isn't a joke. I'm a real guy. After hearing many of my friends and peers bemoaning the fact that they didn't have dates, boyfriends, etc. for the upcoming parties and events, I decided to put myself out there. Of course, already being friends, I didn't approach them about offering to take them out, but nonetheless I thought it might be a good, fun and intriguing idea that would make everyone happy.What does Rent-A-Gent do? I will be happy to accompany you to a party, event, night on the town, casual date or just sightseeing if you're new in town or just bored. I can pick you up or meet you there. You decide.Who is Rent-A-Gent and what might make him interesting or intriguing to you?
I am a 48-year-old caucasian straight male who is divorced
I am 6 foot 6 and weigh around 235 pounds
I have no facial hair, tats or piercings
I've been told I'm both imposing and approachable at the same time - probably because I have big shoulders, but also have a quick, easy smile and look like the guy-next-door
I have a Master's Degree
I can speak easily about virtually any subject - from politics to history to philosophy to sports
I won't get slobbery drunk and embarrass you in front of everyone
If we went to a party or an event, I would actually speak to your friends and 'mingle' instead of sitting sullenly by myself at the table
As a date, I can be as detached (just a friend) or as cozy to you as you wish me to
I will wear cologne - but not too much and it won't be AquaVelva
I won't try to make an unsolicited pass at you that would make things awkward
I would notice if you wore something new or changed cut/color of your hair
I'm as comfortable in a dive bar as I am in an Art Museum
I listen. I also talk, but I don't dominate the conversation. And I actually talk about the things you're interested in - which probably ISN'T Hunting, Fantasy Football or WWE. But hey, if you do like those things, I can talk about them as well
I'd like to think I have a great sense of humor which can range from silly and goofy to punny to dry and satirical
I can behave like a responsible adult or a carefree and spontaneous partner in crime
I drive a nice, new car so if I did pick you up, you wouldn't show up in a clunker
I don't wear tuxedos though. It just isn't my thing
Interested? Intrigued? Drop me a line and let's see if we can make our schedules fit.

title: Looking for storm-chase partners
text:
So, I've been into weather for a while by this point--fifteen years and counting. I have tracked many a storm, taken many photos and videos, and have multiple weather apps on my phone and computer (including RadarScope and PYKL3) that I use daily and religiously. My Xbox is used more for streaming WeatherNation than it is used for actual video games. One thing I haven't done yet, however, is chase storms--which brings me to the purpose of this ad. 

I am looking for one or more other cool people in the area who are either interested in chasing or already chase, who are cool with connecting, building friendship, and chasing together. I do not have a vehicle suitable for such a thing, so hopefully you have one :-)

As far as what I bring to the table chase-wise: I am SKYWARN trained and certified, so no "yahooery" here. As stated earlier, I have fifteen years of experience in meteorology. I have a laptop and a smartphone with an unlimited, sharable mobile data connection, as well as a camera and a scanner. I have a ham radio, and am currently studying for my license. I am also great at navigation. As you may have guessed, this boils down to data monitoring and analysis, photography and videography, and being able to get us around without getting hopelessly lost.

This is a serious ad for serious people. No flakes, assholes, teabag types, or classists need bother.

If you are interested, shoot me an email or a text. Thanks!

title: MacGyver, Simon and Simon, Magnum PI
text:
Hey guys. My name is Brad. I'm a 40 yo, married, new father of a 4-month old boy. Having a son takes up a lot of my free-time, so I find that I'm not able to spend as much time with my old friends as I'd like. For one thing, our schedules conflict, and for another, we don't live all that close to each other anymore.

That's why I'm open to meeting a new set of good guy friends. It's cliche to say things like "I'm laid-back," "down-to-earth," so I'll just skip that bit. Here are a few details about me, though: I grew up in the 1980s for the most part, so I have a soft spot for classic TV shows like those in my heading, and also 80s cartoons like "He-man" and "Thundercats." I grew up with Saturday morning cartoons like "Superfriends" and the original "Scooby Doo." I went to a school where teachers paddled you if you acted up, and I'm no worse for wear because of it. My generation had common sense. I used to climb trees, and pretend that every stick in the yard was either a gun, laser beam or sword. Amazingly, I didn't grow up to be a violent, gun-wielding maniac because of it. Go figure.

I was allowed to play Atari, which I did, but not for hours on end. I loved my family, went to church on Sundays, said my prayers, did my homework on time, and usually made passing grades. When I didn't, I was grounded until I brought my grades up. Surprisingly, I was never tempted to bring a gun to school and go on a murdering rampage. 

I was never confused about my gender. I never thought I was really a girl in a guy's body. Never was tempted to have a sex-change. I was always happy in my pursuit of the fairer sex, and although I got my heart broken a few times, it didn't stop me from eventually marrying.

I'm not big into politics. I'm not hard-core republican, or hard-core democrat. I actually LISTEN to what candidates for the Presidency have to say. If I like what someone has to say, great, if I don't, fine. No one has ever forced me to vote for someone I didn't agree with. I'm not one to settle for the lesser of two evils. I don't mind your political views. I probably really couldn't care less.

I believe in God. I believe in Jesus. I TRY to believe the Bible, but admit that I sometimes struggle with this. There are parts that seem to contradict each other. I don't mind discussing religion, but I refuse to argue about it. I understand that it can be a touchy subject for some, and I respect that. It boils down to this in my opinion: You believe what you will; I believe what I will. None of us was there when the universe was created, so none of actually knows the 100% truth of things.

I think that about covers all the main topics. As far as the smaller details: I've been married almost 6 years. I play guitar and piano. I paint and write and have self-published several novels on Amazon. I make only about $100 a month in royalties, but that's better than nothing. The Beatles are my favorite band. I can enjoy most types of music, but don't prefer gangsta rap or death metal. I'm a good listener, and enjoy new and intriguing topics. I miss having good buddies to talk with about the mysteries of the universe. I've never been to prison. Never robbed a bank or convenience store. I'm kind to kittens. I don't smoke or do drugs. I don't chew tobacco. I like to think I have pretty good manners. I talk to my mom on the phone at least twice per week. I love my wife. I argue with my wife sometimes. I would like to get back into lifting weights and lose 20 pounds. 

Well, if you're still reading this, and if you find a common thread in any of it, please feel free to write me. Let me hear about you and your world now. I'm open to meeting many new friends. I live in Allen, literally right across the street from Plano, so if you're in my area, that's a definite plus. If you live too far out, then we can still be pen pals I guess.

Any road, I hope you have a great day, and a happy 2016!

title: Are you married? Are you female? Are you married and female?
text:
Hello,

I am looking for a married woman who is bored. Maybe you're looking for someone to un-bore you. Or excite you. I don't know, let's not get crazy here, we're perfect strangers so let's not get our hopes up too high. In order to qualify for this ad you need to fit the following requirements:

A. You must be a woman
B. You must be married
C. You must be both A. and B.

If you answered C. then you should reply. There are very strict requirements, as you can see. Some people call me picky but those people have never had to search for a married woman before. Also, you should probably have eyes so you can read what I write you.

A little bit about me:
People tell me I look like Tom Cruise if he was thrown down a few flights of stairs then run over by a cement truck which was filled with sulfuric acid. I'm on the thin side but I eat a lot of pound cake so that should be changing soon according to poundcakediet.com. I like outdoor activities like walking to my car and walking into my house. I enjoy indoor activities such as reading shampoo bottles and doing push ups when no one is looking. Push ups are a great exercise but after two I get really tired, so I make sure no one is around to see how weak I am.

I'm into my thirties and I don't really care what you're into, as long as it's not your seventies or eighties, or seventeenies. I'm into monster trucks, regular trucks, ice cream trucks and remote control trucks. I don't own a truck unless you count Hot Wheels but those are too tiny to get inside. I do have a car you can fit in if you want to ride around in it. It's kind of an economy car so I'm not sure why you would, but hey, it's cool. We all have our weird little things we like.

I'm into flirting. I've been told I'm the George R.R. Martin of steamy romance. I've also been told I am the J.R.R. Tolkien of non-fiction. I have no idea what that means but I think it's a compliment.

In addition to all these qualities I also have never been convicted of murder or kidnapping. Convicted is the key word here. I just want to be honest and up front, just like my hero Lance Armstrong. That guy is no dope.

Anyways, I've got to get going but please respond if you're a married woman.

title: Dark dangerous story...
text:
I'm looking for a female collaborator or roleplayer to explore a romantic/dark fantasy story idea I have. We don't really know each other well, but we're part of a group scheduled to go on a hiking trip in a remote wilderness area. When we arrive at the trailhead we discover that everyone else has cancelled and we are the only ones there. We decide to go ahead and hike, each feeling an unspoken attraction for the other and both feeling adventurous and wanting to see where this leads. 

Several miles into the trip we meet another couple, which is odd since the trailhead itself is remote and we were the only people in the parking lot. At first, they come across as being nice, if a bit weird. They assume we're a couple and that adds to the growing sexual tension between us. But before long, they suddenly turn on us. They hold us at gun point and handcuff us and inform us that we're going to be playing a hunting game with them. One where they are the hunters and we are the prey. To be sporting they say they will be using high powered airguns or (blowguns or something that will take a lot of hits to bring a person down) but they still have real guns which they promise to use if we don't play by the rules. They tell us that if we can make it back to our cars, we're free to go, regardless of whether we've been hit or not. But if they can bring us down...well, they don't tell us what they'll do, but we get the idea its not good for us. Then they strip us both to the waist and take away all or most of our gear. They lock us to a tree with a timed lock set for 30 minutes. When the timer is up, the game is on.

Where does the story go from here? Do we successfully evade the hunters? Do we turn the tables on them somehow? Or do we end up in their clutches, wounded and at their mercy? Is there a happy ending? or does it end darkly and we're never seen again, everyone assuming we just disappeared? Do we find ourselves drawn to each other in the shadow of danger? Or do we fight like cats and dogs and blame each other as things go wrong? Are you nearly paralyzed with fear? Or does a part of you find the challenge alluring, like a moth to a flame?

If you find this interesting and can imagine yourself as the girl in the story, I'd like to talk to you (email or YIM or something. I'd like to get your perspective on what you'd be thinking, feeling, fearing, hoping, etc.. And, if possible, maybe turn this into a collaborative short story or maybe play it out as a roleplay in chat.

If you think this is really stupid and juvenile, you're right, but its also a creative outlet for me and hopefully anyone else who's interested. 

Anyway, i'm not really interested in meeting in person, looking for more of a penpal, but i won't rule it out.

title: Travel Buddy
text:
I am looking for a travel buddy!

When: I start school in May so I am thinking March-April. Length TBD.

Where: Initial idea is Europe but I'm not opposed to Africa or Central/South America. North America is my last choice (I've been to ~40 countries and not looking for repeats - we can talk)

Some things about me to determine if I am the right travel buddy for you:

-I'm a Returned Peace Corps Volunteer so I'm used to roughing it. I like street food and cheap hostels - if you're looking for a cushy trip, this won't be it!

-This isn't freshman year study abroad. I'm not clubbing, tripping acid, or doing anything that requires calling an embassy.

-I hate owning things so minimal time will be spent shopping. But when it comes to food and experiences, I'll throw down. Boutiques no, camel riding yes.

-I'm a pretty seasonal traveler. You don't have to be, but DON'T be an "Ugly American." No complaining when shit goes wrong, no yelling at people in English, and no taking a billion goddamn pictures on the sidewalk. And if you order McDonald's, I'll slap it out of your hand. 

-I'm pretty low maintenance and relatively clean - I hope you are too. And also very prompt - I hate running after public transportation!

Most of the trip will be sight seeing, eating, maybe a museum. If hiking or other adventures come up, that too.

Hopefully you have:
Backpack (I'm bringing 55L)
Passport
Credit cards that work overseas (we're going halvsies, if that's not clear)
Language(s) in your back pocket OR hella good charade skills
Knack for directions and (maybe) fixing cars
Intl data plan not required but an excellent bonus

title: Looking for signs of intelligent life (on hold)
text:
I placed my ad on hold because of many replies and also because I'll be unavailable for a few weeks.

Hi, I'm just looking to have a platonic relationship/companionship with someone on my intellectual level, who also has some personality. It's not like the bar is that high, however, I find it rather difficult these days to find anyone who can reach it. I like to hike, bike ride, play card/trump games, watch movies, eat meals, attend entertaining and/or cultural events, have good conversation, you know, the normal stuff. 

My views tend to be a little radical for most folks living in this part of the country - I'm very progressive-minded, passionate about climate change/environmental issues, not religious, and if you must put a label on me, I would probably best fit into a category of Hippie, though, I'm not a hippie. title: Where has God gone?
text:
I don't know where to start. I raised two boys who are both now in their 30's. Over the years, I have been a Respiratory Therapist a computer programmer, Systems Analyst, Systems Manager, R&D Engineer, IT Consultant and Turnkey IT solutions provider.

When my youngest son developed s schizophrenia 18 years ago, I learned how tough it can be to fight a system that benefits by turning it's back on the disadvantaged and the disabled.

A year ago, I sent my son to live with his mother in Florida and have since been trying to understand what God wants from me. i abandoned my old life and have lived alone in the woods for the past year.

For money, I used to stand on the side of the road and sing. People would stop and give me money. When traffic was to heavy, people would sometimes throw wadded up money at me as they drove by.

The police have decided to stop me from singing on the side of the road. They tell me they will throw in jail if they see me singing on the side of the road again.

I don't know what to do. Where has God gone? I pray that he will just take me away from this life, but he does not. Am I so bad that God has abandoned me? Are we all so bad that he has abandoned us all?

I am having to steal food from the grocery store to stay alive.

Is there anyone who can help me?

title: Young Stud(ent) Seeking a Fall / Winter ROMANCE...
text:
Hey, Dallas Girls!

How about a Holiday / Winter romance?!?!

I've been single since October and would love to make a new friend with whom I can enjoy the rest of the cold months. Snuggling by the fire, movies, parties, dancing, flirting, bedroom fun and maybe even a quick trip to a beach somewhere warm (south of the border or in the BVI)!

Since becoming single, I've had zero time to date. I have a college and masters degree and my newest job takes up all my time. I Could meet a new girl the old fashion way, i.e. in a bar or something, but I find that to be a little sleazy. Especially considering my intentions (which are to have a casual type of friendship), I'd like to give CL a shot.

A buddy of mine has used CL a few times and had great things to tell me about his luck. I, however, am only looking for try it once. I'm not interested in meeting multiple girl -- just one.

I'm 25, 6'2", in excellent shape, very attractive, and happen to be very well endowed. Hopefully, that isn't too much info. Just thought I'd share it now in case you're turned off or scared by "large" men, lol.

Again to reiterate, I'm not some sleazy guy who's just trying to get laid. I'm legitimately looking for a new friend. Although I will admit that I'd prefer our friendship to be based mostly on chemistry and physical attraction.

I know from reading them that most of these ads are pretty strange and most give very little info about the person writing the ad. I'm hoping that mine stands out. If, however, I left something important out, please feel free to ask me anything. I'm very open-minded and easy to talk with.
I do ask that if you write, you'll please include some info about yourself so I have an idea who I'll be responding to. So long as you do that (and ideally include a photo, or at least stats), I promise to write you back regardless of whether I think we'll find each other physically compatible.

Though very hectic, my schedule IS usually pretty flexible. After emailing and chatting some, we can pick a time and place to meet. I'd prefer it be someplace public the first time -- that way we're both comfortable meeting a stranger, lol.

I don't have a particular "type" of girl I'm drawn to, and would love to hear from girls of all shapes, sizes, ethnicities and ages.

I could write a novel with this ad, but for now I'll cut it short. Looking forward to meeting someone new, interesting and excited and enjoying some of the rest of the Winter together!

title: Anyone interested in starting a fun group....
text:
Hello Ladies,

I am sure there will be those of you who feel i should not post here, but to be honest if i post in the casual section i am sure I will only receive a lot of solicitation. I am mid 40's WM who is intersted in starting a group of adults interested in sharing fantasies. When I lived in Pheonix, I had belonged to a group where like minded men and women got together, usually groups as smal as 4 and as big as 10, to have something similar to a book club. Though our club usually was to share fantasies. most of a sensual nature where each person would have that opportunity to describe in great detail their innermost thoughts. I have attempted this in the past with not much success mostly because it is easy to find guys who want to share but it is harder to find women willing to open up to new people and share these things. I found that doing it with strangers was good that you didn't feel like you would be judged (or care for that matter) 

The guys will be carefully selected and their ability to share their thoughts at leaast in writing will have a lot to do with their opportuniy to be invited. I mean if all they have to offer is "I think about doing her" that does not offer much for the rest of the group. But if you can articulate your feelings and wishes, vocalize how you think it would be, who it would be with, give a setting, then maybe.
For the ladies you also have to be descriptive, as again we are using our imaginations and even with a little wine in us there still needs something to get the thoughts rolling.

1. This is not an orgy or sex club
2. Your privacy is to be respected and you will be asked to respect others
3. Discretion is a must, as no judgemet woul be passed on you if you are married, parnered, single or otherwise

As I said earlier, this group worked in another city, maybe it was one of a kind, if you are intersted send me an e-mail and we can talk about being a founding member...lol 

Happy Hump Day, 

R

title: *Corsicana Tx*
text:
We often think about setting our alarms at 5:45am in order to wake up early and enjoy the peaceful morning to ourselves similar to what we recently read on Huff Po. That quickly goes out the window and our alarms go off at 6am before we hit snooze 2 and sometimes 3 times. It's now close to 6:30am and you've got to get on the move because after all (as much as we want them to be independent) the kids aren't going to dress themselves. Between brushing your teeth and heating up a quick jimmy dean (semi-nutritional) breakfast you remind the kids, again, to put their socks and shoes on. You hear a toddler voice say "I am" only to find them playing with toys, dolls, reading a book or if you're lucky watching Netflix on someone's phone or iPad. Ugh it's now past 7am, everyone is fully clothed, kind of, fed and fixing to load the car. You make a mental checklist of school things needing to be signed and returned, who's got practice today and you kind of begin to make dinner plans. Hoping nothing has been forgotten, you realize that the crock pot is still dirty from the last meal it made. Ugh it looks like take out again, so much for saving money this week or eating healthy. Another one of those QuarkyMomma and ScaryMommy ideas saved for another time. You rush through neighborhood streets hoping traffic keeps moving as you make small talk with the kids about what they're most looking toward to at school. You mindlessly listen as they continuously chat but not really say much. Quick kiss goodbye and an I love you to the kids and you drive away begining to think about your own day and realize crap, what about lunch. If you're lucky you remembered and grabbed a tuppaware thing with some type of leftover, if not you realize that you can eat half of your jimmy dean breakfast now and save the rest for lunch. Traffic builds up, speeds slow down and you think, why didn't I just wake up 15 min earlier!? Oh well. 

If you've read this much we've got a whole lot of things in common. See we're not that different. Our marriages and home lives aren't at the point of destruction but let's face it, it's not Facebook perfect either. The spark is gone, the sweet texts are replaced with: do we need anything from Aldi or Wal-Mart? We all have smart phones that constantly send us junk mail about the things we only wish we could do. We get texts from long time friends but it's only when they have time to chat, they hardly reply when I send them a funny meme. Why do we do this to ourselves!?

I'm a married man, college educated with a professional job. Those of us that have worked hard for everything we have know that we've got way to much to lose on some knee jerk reaction of replying to an Internet ad. So why are we here!? If you're like me you miss the spark, the butterflies, the smiles, the excitement, the joy of a sweet compliment. You miss having a reason to dress up, wear earrings and necklaces, get manicures and pedicures, you want to be eager to check your phone after it makes a ding. You want something new without the reproccusions of what might happen if it ever got out that we were on Cl. Don't worry, discretion is a respected two way street. 

Let's wake up early, plan our day and help eachother put a smile on our face as we get through this roller coaster ride we call parenthood. 😊

title: I'm Negative. Are you Positive?
text:
Apparently I'm naturally a very negative person. Everything is doom and gloom. I see the world as a horrible dangerous place and in return overcompensate by constantly trying to control everything around me. I am always anticipating the next bad thing. So, I guess I need someone who's point of view is positive or at least neutral. Someone who will calm me and remind me that there is good in the world. 

I am an emotional roller coaster all the time. But to be fair, I am a female and that tends to be in our nature. I know there a ton of posts that say no drama so let me make this next part clear. I am a responsible adult who keeps their commitments and promises. For some reason, that attracts the most random situations that are by definition DRAMA. It's life. It's reality. Drama is going to happen and for whatever reason it always seems to be thrown in my direction. 

So now I will ask the big question. Do you know anyone that could possibly want to have a friend like me? Maybe it's a group of women. Or maybe it's a guy. I really don't care either way. I care about quality and reliability. I need someone who will be encouraging, sincere, and can help me spin my moods so that I'm not always so uptight and frustrated when drama decides to once again reel its ugly head. I'd like someone I can count on to answer my texts or emails fairly quickly. Sadly, I tend to take a while to text back. 4 kids tend to keep me busy and I don't normally know where my phone is half the time because they move it. 

I need a real friend. Or FRIENDS. I need an adult in my life. If you know any person, group, or are the person I have described then please send me an email. If not. . .. . .well, a girl can still dream.

title: story time?
text:
You bored? Me too... sometimes I like to write......... it really helps to have someone in my head to write about. Maybe that's you! 

Be a muse. It might be fun.


It was another long day for both of them. He was in the car on the way and she was still at work. The grind of life was working hard on both of them. They had enough, really in some ways more than they ever thought they would but more is always better and so they worked.

There were important things that worked out like they should. They both made sure their respective families had everything necessary and in some cases not so necessary to grow into the strong people they hoped they would be some day. Those were the important parts that kept them working. But they both had days in their respective lives where they needed a break. He had intense stress at work to do more, be more and grow and she had life stresses that made every penny count. So today was any other Monday, everyone's favorite day of the week. What was good about Monday? Well this Monday in particular had a plan.

He had been working in and out of town for sometime now and being home in his house was at least as odd as being gone to the rest of the inhabitants. So today, when he wheeled out the bag and kissed his wife bye, was no different than any other trip. She on the other hand had arranged with her soon to be x spouse to take the kids. So as it turned out, today wasn't just a usual Monday... it was the release from the grind. It was escape. It was fantasy. It was the life no-one really had, but occasional someone could steal. 

He checked into the hotel and the nice looking young lady smiled at him as she looked at his address. You seem to be local sir. He smiled. Yes. Just needed a night of fun in this happy little city. You are here for two nights. Yes.. that will be fine. I see you have requested a high floor and one of our Luxury Suites. He smiled at her, "if you are going to take a break, you may as well take a good one". The young lady was tapping away at the keys and a small frown came across her face and then a few taps more and her beaming smile came back to life. "Well I am afraid that we are out of Luxury Suites this evening, but we do have an Omni Suite available. It is a lovely room, and I think you will find it more than acceptable" Its on the fourty-second floor, facing downtown and it has just a wonderful view from the private patio balcony. 

Is there anything I can get you for the room? 

Does it have a bar? 

Yes Sir, a full bar, everything in the room is complementary with the room, so enjoy. 

Turn-down service this evening ? Yes please, about 8 would be fine. 

And with that, she handed him the key and he wheeled off toward the elevator. He paused a few feet away and wandered back... I am expecting another guest this evening, could you see to it that she gets this envelope and a key when she arrives.

He went to the elevator, slipped the card key in for access to the floor and hit the button. The elevator shot upwards and as it lifted from the ground he felt the stress of his life stripped from his body. It was as if the elevator only lifted the good bits, and left the rest on the first floor. He exited when the doors opened. It wasn't much of a hall as he stepped off, there were only two doors, one to the left and one to the right. Suite 42A. was to his left. As he swiped the key across the lock the double doors released and he entered the massive room. The room was ridiculous. Private master suite, a dining room, and a massive tub in the master bath. He walked out onto the patio that hung from the edge of the building. The glass walls blocked the wind but not the view. 

Her day ended not soon enough to suit her, but it was over all the same. She got to the hotel, and a nice looking young man opened the door to car as she slid out. He smiled, Staying the night miss. Yes. I'll park your car for you. She wandered through the lobby of the hotel, with each step the stress of her life fell with her footstep. She stepped up to the desk and asked for her key key. The clerk handed her the key and pointed her to the elevator. As she turned the clerk said. Oh wait, this envelop is for you. 

As she entered the elevator she opened the envelop and press 42. The elevator raced toward the sky and she read. 

We are going to dinner and maybe a little dancing tonight, you will need to go back down stairs to the store in the lobby. I have picked out a few things that I think you will enjoy. Make sure they fit. Oh and you can only wear what the clerk gives you... Nothing else. Have fun.

She got to the lobby and wandered around a bit until she found a small boutique shop. She walked in and the clerk, an older but nice looking woman walked up to her. She started to open her mouth and the clerk said, he described you very well dear. Come on to the back room. He selected a couple choices for you. He was quite specific ... These were the only choices. 


She tried on each of the outfits, pretty short frilly country girl clothes, boots and jewelry. She picked the one she liked the most. It fit close through the top, and was dangerously short. She liked to tease him... And she knew that a tight top and a short skirt was a combination that he would not easily resist.

She started to leave and the clerk said ... Just a minute dear he left one more thing. She handed her a box. The box was pink and nicely wrapped. She opened the box and found a simple lace pantie. It was barely anything at all in her hand. She went to the dressing room and slipped off the pink panties she was wearing and slid on the white lace. Her bare sex was now covered in the most delicate of lace and her skirt barely covered the white lace. 

She left the botique, her day clothes in as pretty floral satchel and stepped into the elevator. Everything about her normal life was gone now and it was time for the evening to begin.


She met him on the patio. The sun was long since gone and the night sky in Fort Worth glistened and twinkled with lights. From their balcony on top of the world everything looked small and everything was beautiful. He pressed up behind her. He smelled good. He wore a strong rich scent, just enough of it to seep slowly into her olfactory bundle and activate what few remaining buttons he hadn't already pressed. He stretched her arms above her and pressed her against the glass. He buried his head along the left side of her neck. It tickled his scruff rubbed against her neck. 

Dinner is here. Let's eat and go find some fun.

title: Have you Seen me?
text:
I used to live on the 100 block of E Lynn Creek Drive, though I had a nice home with toys and tr e at s I preferred exploring outdoors. I was very fond of hanging with the colonies of cats off Jennifer Lane and the house with the yellow lab retriever behind my home, he was older but much nicer than my doggy brothers. Anywho, one day after being cooped up for way too long I bolted at the first opportunity I got! Plus there was too much commotion at home I needed a break MeOw! 
Now I can't seem to find my family and it's getting cold, I don't hear my brothers or even my kit sister anymore. I think I am lost but I have a necklace with my name and my mommy's information on it. I know my family is probably worried about me. Please help me find my family.

***Thank you for taking the time to read this, as you can imagine I am distraught over having lost a family member. My furchild Stormie got out while I was in the process of moving and I was unable to find her by the time I had to head out. Our family hast since moved from the area about 8 hours away and sadly I am unable to make any further trips to search for her until May or June. I want to thank the people who have been kind enough to post flyers and check shelters on my behalf! It is truly inspiring especially on days when I lose hope. Thank you! 
Please if you are in the are or are familiar keep any eye out and do not hesitate to contact me! She responds to her name and is super friendly however due to the time past that I assume has been spent outdoors she may be a bit shy. I feel strongly that she is still in the neighborhood and has even visited or hung around our old home however I have not been able to get in contact with the new owner. I believe because she was a frequent regular to the outdoors and was wearing a collar with identification neighbors may not realize she is lost and homeless :(
I have been spreading her flyer like wildfire through social media, snail mail, phone calls to local shelters and anything I can think of! Please if you have any other suggestions on how to spread the word and help reunite me with my baby let me know!***

Stormie
Grey domestic short hair tabby cat, with white chest, paws and eye liner with hints of light tanish color on paws, legs and face. She has green eyes and a unique identifying feature on her underside.
Last seen wearing hot pink nylon collar with purple heart shaped ID tag and silver diamond shaped rabies tag.

title: About me
text: God couldn't decide where to put Dallas, so He closed His eyes and tossed it at Texas. The city skipped off Cedar Hill, rolled down Oak Cliff, and stuck in the Trinity mud. If it had landed a little lower, it'd have a beach. A little higher, mountains. All it got was oil. My dad had family here, but right after we came to town, there was a president got killed right downtown, so I thought that was normal. And people protesting about not being able to sit at lunch counters, so I thought the food must be really good at those places. Turns out I was wrong on both counts. So then I found out I was wrong about a lot of things and started protesting with my friends, drinking, and smoking a brand you can't get at the grocery stores. Seemed like things got better after a while. Finally I settled down and raised a family here, and it's funny to think about how I had kids born here and there, at places I drive by sometimes. So now it's not such a bad place after all. The people are pretty friendly. It kinda grows on you. But sometimes I wonder if we're headed back to the bad old days.

title: The spark and how/why it grows or fades
text:
Hello all, 

I have quite a few thoughts I would like to put out there in the Craigslist world. 

Men. Women. Boy meets Girl. Girl meets boy. Love. Romance. Marriage (perhaps). Then one day with or without warning...boom goes the dynamite! There are wounds and perhaps even unanswered questions that linger for what feels like forever. Eventually, the cycle might begin again and maybe even go full circle, except this time the wounded party is hoping that there is no boom. There might or might not be marriage again depending upon the respective parties. For the romantic in all of us, we are here within the web of Craigslist searching. For forever. For right now. For a rebound. For a friend. For a lover. For more. 

Think about it for a minute. Aren't we all looking for something. A metaphorical spark plug if you will. From a (divorced and somewhat broken) guy's perspective, I would consider myself a romantic at heart but no where even remotely qualified to know what makes you lovely ladies tick. More on that in a moment. But first, the spark. When first ignited, it is quite remarkable. The butterflies seem to be the equivalent of that spark. Perhaps that is what we are here in search of. Maybe not. Assuming that we are, if the spark dissipates too soon we find ourselves back at the starting line yet again. I know I have found myself at that same line in what feels like a pouring rain looking down at a fire that is impossible to light thanks to the never ending rain, not to mention not having an umbrella. I usually love the rain (and smell of it), but not at this point...I'm sure you can relate.

When the spark is kept alive and able to transform into a flame, that is when it can be truly exciting. It seems that this is when the little things are done by both parties on a regular basis. Surprises happen. Unexpected laughter erupts. Your cheeks hurt. Dates are a regular event. Nothing bothers either of you. Here is a critical moment. The relationship usually blossoms and years tend to fly by. Then, without warning, you notice the little things that drive you nuts about the other person. You wonder why there has not been a special date lately. Where are those once familiar butterflies? Why does everyone else seem to be so happy when you find yourself now discontent? Can it have been prohibited? I think so. But it involves a nasty four letter word that many people despise. Work. It is not easy, but sure can make all the difference. 

Grain of guy truth - as many of you women are keenly aware, we are visual characters whereas you lovely ladies are still visual, but definitely more auditory. Men will most likely notice women while out on their daily routine, and some may have a daydream about it (and nothing more will happen except for the true playboys and they are not the usual relationship type anyway). They will return to you and be happy to have you in their life. Women will also likely notice men, and I would think they may have the same thoughts as the men here with the same outcome. Here is where I think the problems arise. Lack of communication. I am not saying to go home and say ,"wow I saw the hottest person today..." There are plenty of hot people on tv, the movies, the magazines, the internet, etc. My belief is that perhaps the men are falsely expecting the women of their lives to do things that they have dreamed up within their minds (Kind of like the Friends episode when Joey and Chandler got free porn). I think that women would play along with their men, on occasion, if the guys would just have a casual conversation about it but not make it a huge deal. Or I just might be way off base here.

Back to work. Think of this for a moment. Look around. Try to guess who is dating? Are they newly dating? Have they been together for several months? A couple of years? Are they married? Try to guess for how long. It is my observation that the longer a couple has been together, the more distracted they are and the less engaging they are with each other. I think one of the keys to success is to talk to each other without fear just like in the beginning. Love should not just be a simple phrase said out of obligation, but from an act brought out from an emotion so strong that it is in explainable with words, but clear by the actions between them. It would be incredible to see it grow stronger (as it should) rather than fade. 

Yes, most guys enjoy sports and maybe video games just as you gals enjoy shopping and going to the salon. Either way, I believe it is healthy for both parties to have their own needs to keep themselves recharged and refreshed in order to have a healthy and growing relationship. 

Well, I have consumed enough of your time. Hope you have a wonderful day.

title: Seeking 30-something, educated, sane
text:
Over the years, I've had a couple of very pleasant extended interactions with women I've met via Craigslist. As you might imagine, this hasn't come easily. I've posted quite a few times, and most of the responses have been somehow off the mark. Sometimes respondents have been looking for a different kind of interaction; many times there has been a simple lack of chemistry; and, because it's CL, frequently the problem has been sheer lunacy on the part of the respondent.

With that history in mind, I think I can do a better job of articulating what I'm looking for and which type of woman might be the best fit for me in this endeavor. Please note: I'm not offering any kind of authoritative global commentary on what's "right" or "good" here; I'm merely stating what works for me -- an admittedly imperfect person. I respect the fact that it might not appeal to everyone, but I'm probably not interested in having an extended argument about how misguided or unfair I am. 

First, a little about me: I am an academic in my late 40s. I'm married and have a couple of kids. I am generally content with this situation. Truth be told, I'm not desperately unhappy. However, I find myself somewhat restless, and looking for sustained connections online. My goal in doing this isn't to engage in a torrid physical affair (more on that later) but rather to find steady electronic interaction (mainly via email) with someone who stimulates me intellectually, emotionally, and physically. Only one or two email per day probably won't be sufficient to hold my interest. And -- despite the length of this posting -- I'm usually not someone who writes a short essay with each response. I'm looking for short but fairly steady contact (knowing, of course, that sometimes life gets in the way and one can't always respond immediately).

My partners in this kind of interaction invariably have been younger -- usually women in the 32-40 age range. I am not sure why this is --honestly I'm not obsessed with the idea of connecting with a "younger woman" -- but I have found it to be comfortable. Also, they have been reasonably well educated and engaged in professional careers. (No, I won't be expecting to see a resume, but there will be more common ground with someone in a white collar occupation.) I'm a fit, active person, and I'd prefer someone who is similarly inclined (runner, yogi practitioner, etc.), or at least fits into the "HWP" category. There are some other characteristics that I value, but they seem rather generic and subjective: sense of humor, literacy, taste in music, books, wine, etc. 

Finally, regarding the possibility of meeting in person: It's not my primary goal. Furthermore, I'm posting this ad outside the area where I actually reside, so it would be extremely difficult to pull off. However, with the right person and under the perfect set of circumstances, I would entertain the possibility.

But first, let's email.

title: Wants Opinions on my Marriage
text:
I'm in a difficult situation with a hard decision to make. I've spoken to my friends, but of course they are biased on the situation. I figured it would be nice to hear some opinions on this from people that do not have a connection to either myself or wife. 

Background/Long story short: 
Wife and I have been married 11 years and have three kids together. Wife cheated about 5 years.


The Dilemma: 
After splitting up for about 6 weeks, we worked things out and everything has been great since then, minus the typical arguments couple gets in (finances, kids). About 3 months ago my wife started working at a pretty busy gym. We're both pretty good looking people and in great shape. I've included a pic of myself, but will respect her privacy. Lately she's been adding some of the guys from the gym on facebook. They will message my wife and chit chat about things. They seem a little flirty from their responses, but she doesn't get flirty. They also like all her facebook posts and pictures (almost like they stalk her page). 

Due to the problems we've had in the past, I expressed my concern over this. I still have insecurities due to what happen. All her response is when I bring this up is that I need to seek professional help to get over my insecurities. I offer for us to go to marriage counseling together to work through them, but she has no interest in doing so. She says it's my issue, I need to fix it myself. I'm at the point it's hard to function during the day. I have 1 month left in my master's degree, and I can't even focus on finishing up my project I'm so worried and stressed over it

Lately I've been severely depressed and worried over the fact she's going to cheat and leave me again, although she tells me otherwise and tells me how much she loves me. Part of me wants to give her the benefit of the doubt. I can't control if guys want to message her on facebook. I can't control if she wants to message them back. I don't own her. I just wish she'd show respect over what we've been through. The other part of me just wants to say it's not worth the pain and agony of what I went through before and just to end it on my terms so I don't get hurt again. 

I know I'm not a bad looking guy. I have a great career. My personality is decent. I'm not the life of the party, but not the most boring person there either. Once I heal over my failed marriage, I don't think I'd have a hard time finding someone that won't do this to me. So it's not like I'm the type of guy to stay because I'm scared of being alone or not finding anyone else. But I don't want to end my marriage if this is just my insecurities getting the best of me, as I do love my wife and cherish my family.

Anyone have any advice on the best course of action? I feel no matter what I do, it will be the wrong choice that will end with someone getting hurt. And of course, I'm going to make my own decision. I would just like to hear input from others that may make me see something from a different perspective.

title: Seems like marriage is overrated

title: Whoa..Sex Toys??
text:
Look, It's the only thing I could think of at the moment that would get your attention.
Since you are reading this, I would have to say that it worked. If the title of the caught your attention, chances are you are probably a pretty cool gal and aren't snotty or uptight like most of the women.
I can honestly tell you that I don't know what the fuck I'm looking for on here. I do know that placing an ad on Craigslist feels like a new low for me though. Seriously, I've been single for a while now and I would just like to meet some new people. Someone to talk to and hang out with. It would be nice to get out again and do something fun for a change. Maybe have dinner or go catch a movie. I'm a man and you're a woman, so I guess the possibility of us screwing is always out there. That's not really why I'm here though. 
If you haven't had a sense of humor about this ad by now, you should probably just close it out now. You are probably a little too stiff for me anyway, and this ad will probably just get worse. I'm not the dicklick you may be imagining by now.. I'm probably one of the nicest guys you will ever meet. 41/White/Single..I'm intelligent and sarcastic. I consider myself to be average looking, but I've always been lucky enough to be with beautiful women. I'm masculine, strong and rugged..I'm a Firefighter if that helps to paint a picture. I may talk a lot of shit at times, but I always treat people right.
I'm looking for someone that knows how to catch a guy's eye. Someone that can make me laugh. Someone easy on the eyes, HWP or close to it.. (A killer rack, million dollar money maker, or some bitchin' legs would be nice too..just sayin') Just be yourself....and please don't be an idiot. I know there are a lot shady fucks out there playing games and starting shit. I don't need any of that. Age is not that big of a deal for me, mid 30's to mid 50's works. Just know how to be a lady when we are out in public. You can curse like a sailor or pick your nose everywhere else, just don't embarrass me to the point of humiliation in public. 
I am a real person, and if you take the time to write me something more than one sentence, I will write you back. Your pic gets mine.. So what the hell do you know about sex toys anyway? Put your favorite sex toy in the subject line when responding so I know you are real..and be honest! I'll do the same when I respond. I'm sure that I'm going to regret this, but what the hell.. Right?

title: What changed?
text:
Okay ladies, help me reason out something... I seem to remember a time when I could meet a nice girl (I imagine you'd meet a nice guy), and we'd talk, get to know each other, and even though we were just friends, we'd be courteous to each other. Return phone calls, return messages, make time for each other express their feelings about where the relationship stands, I mean responsible, direct, and nice. When did things change so that it's acceptable to be unreliable and erratic. When did take it or leave it become the way to be with people? More importantly, when did bitching become a defense after you let someone know their behavior is inconsiderate? I mean when did the world turn conceited and self centered? Ladies I see your side notes to your posts, and know you know what I'm talking about. Are people who know how to tell people what they like about them the minority now? Do people still have a sense of responsibility to keep their word? Does no one want to share experiences but instead see what the other person can do for them? And what of manners?

Even if you're just venting, let me know what you think. I'm trying to wrap my head around this. I've started dating again and wow, a lot has changed since I was last single.

Peace.

title: Something to Think About...
text:
Many people will walk in and out of your life,
but only true friends
will leave footprints in your heart.
To handle yourself, use your head;
To handle others, use your heart.
Anger is only one letter short of danger.
If someone betrays you once, it's his fault;
if he betrays you twice, it's your fault.
Great minds discuss ideas;
Average minds discuss events;
Small minds discuss people.
God gives every bird it's food,
But he does not throw it into it's nest.
He who loses money, loses much;
He who loses a friend, loses more;
He who loses faith, loses all.
Beautiful young people are accidents of nature,
But beautiful old people are works of art.
Learn from the mistakes of others.
You can't live long enough to make them all yourself.
The tongue weighs practically nothing,
But so few people can hold it.

title: Saturday Night Life
text:
We all know it's Saturday because we have been looking forward to this weekend since Tuesday. We have worked all week to enjoy the weekend and yet here it is, and we don't have any plans. 

You're reading countless ads because your friends are all busy, or boring, or doing something with other couples. You want to do something, you want to have some fun ...but what?

Your friends can't understand why you don't have a boyfriend or why you aren't married. You're good looking, take care of yourself, intelligent, you don't need a man to complete you, and have a positive attitude and energy. Your typical response to them is that your busy but the truth is that you're picky, have standards, and there aren't good looking, eligible single men worthy of your company. 

Well if this is a fitting description of yourself, then you're reading an ad from someone who is your equal. So while we both contemplate what each of us should do tonight, I would like to suggest that a well written response is all that separates us from spending another boring and uneventful Saturday night.

I am open to a movie, or dinner, or drinks. As a matter of fact, I am open to anything that gets us out of the house. Yes it's raining outside and the skies are cloudy, so let's find a way to salvage the day and enjoy some Saturday night life. 

So I challenge you to take a moment to tell me something about you. I should have added that I don't like drama and mind games so let's not spend the rest of the day emailing back and forth.

title: Men Who Are Too Gentle to Live Among Wolves
text:
Men who are too gentle to live among wolves. 
by James Kavanaugh 

My lifestyle is born in my heart, born in the pain of ending one life and beginning another, born in the excitement of the continuing search for life's meaning. Some people do not have to search, they find their niche early in life and rest there, seemingly content and resigned. They don't seem to ask much of life, sometimes they don't seem to take it seriously. At times I envy them, but usually I do not understand them. Seldom do they ever understand me. 

I am one of the searchers. There are, I believe, millions of us. We are not unhappy, but neither are we really content. We continue to explore life, hoping to uncover its ultimate secret. We like to walk along the beach, we are drawn in by the ocean, taken in by its power, its unceasing motion, its mystery and unspeakable beauty. We like forests, mountains, deserts, hidden rivers and the lonely cities as well. Our sadness is as much a part of our lives as is our laughter. To share our sadness with one we love is perhaps as great a joy as we can know 

We searchers are ambitious only for life itself, for everything beautiful it can provide. Most of all we want love, and to be loved. We want to live in a relationship that will not impede our wandering nor prevent our search, nor lock us in prison walls; that will take us for what little we have to give. We do not want to prove ourselves to another or compete for love. My lifestyle is for wanderers, dreamers and lovers for lonely men and women, who dare to ask of life EVERYTHING GOOD and BEAUTIFUL. It is for those who are too gentle to live among wolves.

If you have read this far then you are for real. Some times in life it becomes necessary to put ones wants and needs aside for the benefit of others. I have done this faithfully and now must do more for me. If you are also in a committed relationship and can't/won't leave, lets talk! This isn't about a physical relationship. This is about a mental connection first and foremost.

Good Luck and Best Wishes to You All!

title: Email/Voice Friend
text:
I'm out of the country for now and need an intellectual and emotional connection to home--only one. If you're fun, intelligent or smart and feel kindly towards people please read on, I'm all of that and more.

I am not lonely, just recently chose to be alone. Age nor race matter but English language skills do; articulation and an ease with writing does matter; the hope is that you enjoy language and the 'epistolary' art of letter writing. 

I'm older and you might want to be, too, but it's not a deal breaker as all age is relative. Kik is OK but only after a significant relationship occurs and one liners between emails can work. I also have a U.S VoIP number (but Skype is better with or without video), again, whenever that might become appropriate. I'm in the U.S. East Coast time Zone.

I trust you're passionate about your interests and life choices, please tell me of one? I was (still am, I suppose) an offshore sailor. I love the arts, museums, opera and even ballet (esp. Alvin Ailey). All are cool, but live theater is my favorite.

Be respectful and tolerant and while witty cynicism goes a long way to communicate and entertain, please don't be someone who has brought it home as a permanent guest and extols it as an endearing personality characteristic--it's not. 

The phrase that best describes me is a 'renaissance type.' I've traveled, sailed and done corporate startups; I've seen much and done a lot which hopefully means I'm entertaining.

You should be an avid social and political observer and as you follow silly season events like national debates please be one who rejects those who cannot articulate a paragraph much less a complete sentence, however entertaining 'he' might be. [We can discuss the virtue of tolerance later.]

Thank you if you've read this far; if you do respond please put the name of your favorite literary heroine in the subject line? For example, Lady Macbeth or Madame Bovary (well, let's hope neither of them).
