title: A little frustrated in life, need some advice
text: Ok, so posting this from way up north, i live in Fairbanks, Alaska. I need some advice in life. So first off this entire chain of events started about 2 months ago. I ran into some technical difficulties with my phone, to where, A, I ran out of data, and B, I have an odd problem up here to where the phone with not function at temperatures positive 4 degrees Fahrenheit or below. I realize that's not a problem you guys have in Texas. But I do. The second thing that happened right in the same time frame, is that my laptop decided to go wanky. So I had to exchange phones, upgrade the laptop, and during that time I backed off of Facebook. Now how i post is 90% where friends only can see it, and I have posted my phone number numerous times. I figured that if somebody worried, or if needed to contact me if that if I was not on Facebook, that they can just give me a call. I work as a commercial driver up here, I cannot always be to looking at my phone. I'm on the road I do not look at my phone at all, in fact I tell people don't text to me because I can't read what you said until I get off road, and it's not quite like Texas where you have towns every few miles. We have to towns every hundred miles. Then were this really starts coming into play, is that I've always said that my quote friends unquote or more like family. Well, of about 90 people on my friends list, in over 2 months, only one person has called, and it was once. Nobody's tried swing by where I live, which most people know, nor have they made the attempt to swing by my work, which is quite well known where I work. Now, in cities and in states in the lower 48, where you have more people and guess who would be easier, but we don't have a lot of people. Fairbanks is not that big, and i am quite often in smaller towns, that are maybe 5, 10, 15 people. In the distance between those towns, can be hundreds of miles. The next thing that makes this a lot more difficult to then with you guys deal with in Texas, is for the fact that we are still in our winter. Now, what that means is that are night time, is about 12 hours now, when this first began that night was 16 hours. That's a lot of darkness. That is a lot of darkness. And even with hobbies, work, things that need to be done, you take that length of nights, compound that with no people that you have in contact with, and being slightly on the depressed side. No I'm not planning on doing anything stupid, I actually enjoy what I do, but I'm really fighting with my mind and loneliness. Of the final factor to the equation, where I've been single for more than 2 years, still greatly missing the person that I loved when I was young, and I'm 34, and I think you can see where I'm going. I'm beyond frustrated. Now I guess the final piece of this equation, is the hours that we work. Here in Alaska, a commercial driver is allowed 80 hours in a rolling 7 day day time frame, that's it a lot of hours, in very little time to try to find someone to conversate with. I don't know what to do anymore. I need some advice. As far as Facebook I have not posted my frustration, I have not let anybody know the reason why I did the final piece of the back off. It became a test, of people are so this darn connected with this electronic society. Which it looks like they are. To where they cannot even pick up the phone dial 7 numbers, and call somebody. Yes Alaska small enough we do have seven digit dialing. So I'm asking, if you were to even be in a semi similar boat, how would you approach and what would you do. Again I'm not thinking of doing anything stupid, I'm trying to remain positive. But that honestly is becoming harder and harder. Can somebody give me some advice. Thanks. Sign, a friend on the road.

title: Give & Take - Hear me out.
text:
Hello Seekers,

I have chosen my words carefully in the title of my posting to succinctly convey what I am seeking and have to offer. Apart from the dictionary meaning, context is important and hence thought to elaborate to give you insight about the person behind this ad. I happened to read a book titled "Give & Take: Why helping others drives our Success", which resonated with me and is written more in a professional business context. But given where I am at this point my life's journey could have applied to my personal life and the context of my ad.

I am a 38 yr old married educated professional, blessed in many ways but not the one that matters the most; emotional connection. I can share the why and how but have come to realize it's not important to dwell but see if I change it. World is a kaleidoscope of good and bad life situations and experiences. I have been blessed in life and worked hard to gain career and material success and appreciate the struggles folks go thru and the book I referred to earlier suggests a course forward. Put simply I am seeking a good person where friendship can blossom, assuming chemistry, interests and personalities align to fill the void of an emotional connection. In return below are aspects of genuine friendship I have to offer. This Give & Take I hope is a reasonable proposition for what I seek and have to offer.

Generous: Time, Material, Monetary, Altruistic
Gent: Refined, Chivalry, Adventurous, Respectful
Platonic: Non-carnal, Intellectual, Emotional, Connection
Friend: Emotional, Connection, Empathy, Boundaries

As this is an introductory email, I will refrain from the usual descriptions of life interests, hobbies etc which can be discussed if first there is a meeting of the minds. Thanks for reading and if you would like chat or explore more drop me an email.
Till then. . ..

title: Where Are All the Single Moms?
text:
Are there any single Mom's out there that want to make a new friend?

No, it's not a fetish thing. And no, I don't want to be the new Daddy to your kids...

I just find that single Mom's know what's up, you know? They are strong, they don't take any bullshit from people, they have their priorities straight, and they are usually very confident and independent. I like dealing with someone who just says what's on their mind because they don't have time for games, someone who knows what it means to sacrifice and can enjoy what they have when they have it instead of always chasing the next dream or wasting their life.

I'm not saying you shouldn't have aspirations for greatness. But I am far more attracted to someone who is grounded in reality that some starry eyed person with no life experience outside of college. Someone who has their act together, and isn't looking for a hand out, or drug money. 

It also helps to know going into it that the other person in the equation gets what it means to have kids as part of the deal, and won't bust your chops if you cancel plans because you didn't know that have a project due, or you have to take them somewhere, or because you are just worn the f%&^{ out from dealing with them after a long day at work too.

Me, I'm 36, single white Dad of two. I love the shit out of my kids and pretty much everything I do is in service to making their lives better if I can. Second to that, I'm clean, educated, pretty well read, I have a stable job I like, pay my bills, and don't smoke or use drugs.

I would love to meet a calm, pleasant woman who wants to grab a drink, go bowling, hit an arcade, watch a movie, go for a walk. Not a booty call. Not friends with benefits.

Other areas of interest include: dancing, board games, coffee flavored beer, zombies, super heroes, buried treasure, and saying I should work out more and then not doing it and binge watching Netflix instead.

You gotta be out there somewhere, right? Let's connect!

title: Screen Writer Alliance
text:
I have a great screenplay that requires the eye of a gifted writer with industry connections. 
If this is you, I propose a collaboration. 


Gangsters Defend A Community Against Eminent Domain
TONY LANDON'S
NIC'S DIMES & SENSE

An edgy screenplay bound to explode onto the movie scene based upon the premise
"There's A Right Way To Do A Wrong Thing"

In 2018 construction begins on The Warner Washington Tollway. A hundred mile stretch of highway originating in the Fourth District that connects Washington D.C with two Interstate Systems just south of Petersburg Va. An expansion that changes the commute of the millions of riders who use the Toll Way and the lives of the people all around it. 

Our story begins long before the morning Kim exits the Honda in the Balmart parking lot. For her it started in the tracks of her mother's daily injections. A nasty "Speed Ball" that set in motion a chain of events resulting in her very own Eighty Dollar a day Heroin habit. An addiction she and Bug means to facilitate by any means necessary. 

Devices foreseen by Tiffany Mckinzie and passed on to her Balmart staff but to no avail. See! Kim's a dope fiend and the girl's gotta have it. Valentine knows this and has every intention of ensuring that the second Kim sells the thousand dollars worth of inventory she's about to steal from Balmart that he has available to her "China White", the best dope in Richmond. That's why he's in N.Y. 
Buy the best dope at the cheapest price and sell it for less. In no time at all, he'd be a millionaire.

Linwood Brown and his brothers don't see it that way. They control the lucrative Richmond drug market and a host of killers to enforce their will. He admired the gall of the New York and Philadelphia drug dealers who came to Richmond to apply their trade. He'd let them build up a respectable amount of cash before he killed them. As always, an amount worth his time.

None of this escaped the watchful eye of Tuna and in accordance to code he warns a determined Yakoo and Valentine about their ambitious plan.


A plan that didn't include meeting and falling in love with the voluptuous Ricca Sanchez. 
The day they walk into her brothel, she had no way of knowing their entwined destiny. 
It wasn't just her heart that brought her to Richmond. She was on a mission. 

A mission that would pit her against gangsters, corrupt politicians and ruthless Billionaire Charlie Warner. A man not accustomed to taking "No" for an answer. That includes his daily pursuit of sexy secretary Nina Johnson. Even the Police Commissioner was subject to the whelms of Warner Billups. He turns a blind eye on the money bought gangsters imported on Charlie's behalf. Of course none of this would have mattered if Tuna didn't have a plan of his own and Estelle Jacobs, a pillar of her community, hadn't been so self righteous. Emerson Parks warned her that she should take the money and run. That's what he did and he took the young and impressionable Jamekia Jackson with him.



That didn't sit well with his wife, the refined Sherri Parks and she confessed the same to Rev. Adare just before she's ravished.

It was almost too much for Craig Martin to fathom. Neither his MIT education nor his military training prepared him for the ruthlessness of Lagan Holmes. A born killer who takes particular pride in his work. Confused? So were Richmond Detectives Hobo and Jesus when the bodies started showing up.

They figured Gray had something to do with it but he'd disappeared. Don't blame them though. No one could have imagined that this many powerful people would have so much vested in a small neighborhood far from them all. In the end, it's a matter of Nics, Dimes & Sense that won't be resolved until the final pages of this twisted story of not so good versus evil reaches its climactic resolve. 

NIC'S DIMES & SENSE
"A GANGSTA STORY"


This document is protected under the copyright laws of the United States.
No part of Nics, Dimes & Sense may be reproduced in any manner without the express written consent of the copyright owner 2008.



If you're interested in knowing more about NDS then send me your contact information along with your ideas of what is to be next. I'd love hearing from you. Until then, take care and all the best to your family.

title: Do married women read 'Strictly Platonic' posts?
text:
I'm not sure exactly what to write, or even if my intended audience reads these posts. I'm a professional, handsome, married man who is not looking for a sleazy encounter or a one-night/day stand. I am not into younger women and certainly am not looking for a "professional" lady (of the night), thank you very much.

What I seek is simple, yet seemingly very elusive - a classy married attractive woman who takes care of herself for secret friendship. I'm the handsome married-guy-next door type, that exercises and takes care of himself, and I'm looking for that selective, ultra-discrete, emotionally secure Mom that I see and smile at when going to our kids games or grocery shopping. Trying to be very discrete myself, I'm not sure how to approach such a woman and not risk unfortunate consequences. So here I am, posting amongst the college kids and web-cam professionals.

Neither of us is looking for a permanent escape from our married lives. We are both actually happy/content in many ways in our married lives, yet miss the communication, the flirting and the sensual attention and appreciation from the opposite sex. We both have busy, active lives, and understand the importance of family, and while we can enjoy ourselves together, our fun times will always take a back seat to maintaining our real world lives.

But our rendezvous will leave us both recharged and reenergized, and give us that escape into pleasure and sensuality that is a piece of ourselves not being explored. Thanks for reading, I hope the special woman I describe is out there and reading this now.

These women's standards are very exacting though. For instance, the "companion male" must be very intelligent, secure, classy, educated, interesting, tall, dark (or light, in some cases), and handsome!

In any case, here is a married male who is interested in experimenting with the possibility of a platonic relationship with another female. The intent is not to use this as an illicit avenue for meeting up or have sex eventually. Like the women I was referring to above, I do have some preferences though. title: Anticipation and Butterflies
text:
I thought I would try something new for purposes of meeting a smart, attractive, passionate and educated woman. I have no idea if CL will bear any fruit but I am hopeful that there is someone out there like me and we can connect at some level. I am a married man who is ambitious, unselfish, handsome, playful and I love laughter. I am passionate, kind, confident, gentle, loving, affectionate and respectful. 

I'd like to remain optimistic and believe that having a soul-mate with a strong mental connection is still possible. It's more about companionship at this stage for me. Ideally, I would like to get to know someone who is a busy professional (or busy stay at home mom) who has some time in her life to get together for coffee, lunch, good conversations via email and Google chat, in hopes of getting to know one another. I am looking for someone that has a great personality and humorous. I still believe in chivalry and I hope you won't mind if I open doors for you. One important point, I don't want games or crazy! 

I am a married man, who is fun, blunt, playful and sensitive. I enjoy going out and love to stay home and cuddle up on the couch watching a movie. I enjoy reading, cooking, dancing, hanging with family and friends. There is so much more I could share, but let's leave that for the first conversation or perhaps date....

So, if you're in search for someone to add to your happiness, support your ideas, share in your laughter, be strong through the storms and who will celebrate you all day long... Here I am. Please put the area you live in the subject line.

title: Are you a married mom, seeking a virtual friendship?
text:
I'm not exactly sure why I'm posting this, but here goes. If you're a married mother of younger kids, sometimes wanting to have a close friend to talk to, and not looking for anything physical but essentially an online connection, our situations might be similar. Do you feel like you have things to say, but sometimes keep them to yourself; not because they're highly personal but maybe your spouse just doesn't hear you? You do have friends, but you still feel there's a certain kind of connection that's missing, something you'd like to explore? If all of that's hard to put your finger on, it sounds like me.

I'm married, in my 40's, have younger children, educated, well traveled, creative, and generally have a happy life. But I sometimes miss having as many friends as I used to before marriage. It would be nice to connect with someone who is in a similar situation, would like to have an open dialogue about things, maybe personal, maybe topical. Are you intelligent, articulate? If so, I would like to start this friendship by emailing and see if we click. Again, I cannot over stress the "platonic" nature of this friendship, as there is no way I'm looking to change my situation or anyone else's. If this sounds like something that you might be interested in, please write me back. I would appreciate if you start of by telling a little bit about yourself, and what made you respond to my post. If interested, in the subject line please write the color of panties you last wore..smiles!

title: The complexity of a long marriage
text:
I really can't say that life is bad, but it sure isn't the way I thought it would in a marriage that's lasted this long. The "partnership" is viable, although it's more like a business partnership. It reminds me of a home that's vacant. There's nothing wrong with it in one sense, but in another way it's totally wrong. I find myself missing the personal connection we used to have.

I've learned that you can't change the other person in a situation like this. Try it yourself if you can relate to this post. Approach the problem in a logical and adult manner. Lay your feelings out to your partner. Even if it's well received, you're likely to see that people can change for a brief period of time, but they inevitably come back to what's right for them. This isn't wrong. In fact, it's evidence in itself that we're all different and that any attempt to change someone is problematic by its very nature. It's unworkable. It's unreasonable. In a way, it even seems unethical.

At the same time, I'm finding it difficult to accept my own situation. To do so is nothing less than allowing the circumstances to change me against my will. Slow death of the soul. After considerable thought, I believe that accepting responsibility for my own happiness is the only alternative. The only way to keep my sanity.

I would like to have an occasional lunch or dinner companion.

I would like to spend a day at the movies with a friend.

If you're in a similar situation, I would like to exchange some emails and get to know you.

title: Where Are All the Single Moms?
text:
Are there any single Mom's out there that want to make a new friend?

No, it's not a fetish thing. And no, I don't want to be the new Daddy to your kids...

I just find that single Mom's know what's up, you know? They are strong, they don't take any bullshit from people, they have their priorities straight, and they are usually very confident and independent. I like dealing with someone who just says what's on their mind because they don't have time for games, someone who knows what it means to sacrifice and can enjoy what they have when they have it instead of always chasing the next dream or wasting their life.

I'm not saying you shouldn't have aspirations for greatness. But I am far more attracted to someone who is grounded in reality that some starry eyed person with no life experience outside of college. Someone who has their act together, and isn't looking for a hand out, or drug money. 

It also helps to know going into it that the other person in the equation gets what it means to have kids as part of the deal, and won't bust your chops if you cancel plans because you didn't know that have a project due, or you have to take them somewhere, or because you are just worn the f%&^{ out from dealing with them after a long day at work too.

Me, I'm 36, single white Dad of two. I love the shit out of my kids and pretty much everything I do is in service to making their lives better if I can. Second to that, I'm clean, educated, pretty well read, I have a stable job I like, pay my bills, and don't smoke or use drugs.

I would love to meet a calm, pleasant woman who wants to grab a drink, go bowling, hit an arcade, watch a movie, go for a walk. Not a booty call. Not friends with benefits.

Other areas of interest include: dancing, board games, coffee flavored beer, zombies, super heroes, buried treasure, and saying I should work out more and then not doing it and binge watching Netflix instead.

You gotta be out there somewhere, right? Let's connect!

title: Nature's Lament(our sad butts)
text:
Hi there. I'm an active, taken, 25 y.o. guy whose looking for a female friend. Please bear with me, as I feel it's best for me to write my feelings to explain what I'm looking for. so, here it goes..

I have been in a relationship for almost three years, and I miss having a great friendship with a woman. As dominant as I am, I miss having a great female friend as a peer. It's difficult to put into words.. the feelings I experience, the motivation, the comfort, and breath of life I get from a great friendship with a wonderful person.

I miss having a friend I can touch and have physical contact with, too. Even just the slightest touch on the shoulder, or back, can mean so much to me. I miss being able to see your smile while having fun, and feeling loved.

Between work and school, my social life is pretty much non existent. It'd be nice to go over to someone's place to just watch a lovely movie, or just talk while going on a walk.. or play some sport together like tennis, or volleyball!.. maybe a workout buddy at the Rosemead rec center? *nudge nudge*

It'd be nice to actually help each other out, emotionally, as well. I know there are a few things I'd like to get a second opinion on! I wish we could give helpful/constructive criticism to each other though out our endeavors...

Idk.. if you feel like you need me & would like to see my face around your place, let me know.

For those who are still reading, and interested, here are my stats; 6'3", white, 25, balding dirty blonde, fit(almost athletic), Pieces, D.D.F., casual drinker, and okay with you smoking.. I quit smoking cigarettes a few years back, but pretty chill.

I'll provide pictures for those who are interested. Go ahead and send me photos, as I want to know who I'll be hanging out with in the near future. :P

Hopefully, I'll hear from you soon.

Sincerely,
A friend in need.

title: Let's chat!
text:
I am: 25, BBW, married.

I am looking for a Kik buddy that is open to chatting about any topic, from simple everyday things to deep conversations that shouldn't be repeated. If we hit it off and decide to meet as friends in the future, that would be wonderful, but it isn't an expectation. Either way, you should live in DFW just in case. If you are uncomfortable with certain topics or are so reserved that you will not send me your picture, there is no need to waste our time. I'm an "anything goes" type of person and I expect the same. 

I do not care what your home life looks like, but I do need to make one thing explicitly clear: My home life won't change because of you. I am happily married to a great man, and it isn't one of those "I'm happy married but I cheat/lie and I'd drop him for someone cuter/smarter/wealthier/better" situations. It is safe to say that as open as I am in my chats, I am even more open with my husband. He knows about my chatting habits and essentially everything else there is to know about me. 

Now to get down to the nitty gritty because everyone loves to read between the lines even when they suck at it: This is not a sexual posting in the least. I won't say that I don't chat about sex or send inappropriate pictures because shit happens, but if that is what you are seeking, you are barking up the wrong tree. If the conversation strays and suddenly your dick seems to be out every time we try to chat, you've completely lost my interest. I know the difference between a friendship that is strictly platonic and one that is a casual encounter. I would classify this as mostly platonic. 

If you are interested in chatting, please send me a Kik message to frumpies with some information about yourself.

title: I Am Really Not Sure What I Want ?
text:
Not Sure What I Want ?

I have posted on CL before . . .

I am just not sure what I want, are you ?

I have posted for just romance and nothing else and got some responses, but nothing worked out.

I have been tempted to answer, in fact I have, some of the posts for FWB and Let's DO IT not sure what to expect ?

That was an even bigger failure than the Romance Post plan.

Let me say that I AM married, that will never change for reasons I will not get into right away. Life can be complicated and sometimes you have to fulfill your obligations even if it means enormous compromise.

But at the same time, if I cannot live life and be me . . . then I am cheating myself and everyone around me. I know this sounds very selfish and self centered. Sorry I have to still live and breathe and see the world around me.

There is alot I desire, there is alot I miss, there is so much I want to experience again, and yet I know I must just be patient and take things very, very slow.

I have had a few things happen in my life that brought me to this place and if I found someone who truly wanted to know I would share some of this.

So where do we draw the line ? What is OK and what is not ?

I am also not vanilla ice cream by any stretch of the imagination, not that this may come into play with whatever may come from this,

What that means, and it is a very wide ranging topic, is that I crave passion and kissing and more, but NOT the typical Craigslist Quick Hook Up, in fact I am not sure fucking will be a part of this, although there are so many things I do crave and wish to explore with another who, like me, knows there is more and either is aware or not sure that more is or means.. I will just have to hope that YOU, if there is a YOU out there get this . . . even if only conceptually.

The only way you are still reading this is if you are feeling some commonality or curiosity. This will not be tame, but it is not about anything to be afraid of either, in fact what we crave is excitement beyond the simple that most are satisfied with.

I am not a simple person, even though what I think that I want is quite simple. If you are easily embarrassed or offended this may not be for you, since I want to push things to the very edge, but only out here in the safety of cyber-space at first. So there is very little to fear or worry about.

I know I have not been very clear in what I am looking for or what I want, thus the title, remember the subject line of this post ?

I am hoping you partially get it and have been wondering the same thing about yourself, or are after reading this.

So if you feel the same reply NOW, please put " I am not sure either " in your subject line so I know it is a sincere reply

Then you better buckle up, cause it may be a very wild ride, if we do it right ?

OH yes I really would like to know who I am talking to, I hate to do this it is so shallow, but I really have a thing about eyes and I need all the rest too, I read people and your detailed description of you will help me hear you and feel you.

A couple of things, you should be over 18, but beyond that your age is meaningless to me. I prefer a woman who is shaped like a woman, this does not mean you have to be a Barbie Doll, but you have to be somewhat smaller in the middle that the top and bottom and I apologize if this is not you, but it is what works for me. Just to be clear BBW won't work for me, sorry to be blunt. You need to live in the DFW area, if you are outside the area, this is an exercise in futility, unless you travel here OFTEN or something like that.

So are you the ONE that read this whole post and "get's it" if so . . . . ANSWER ME NOW . . . . RIGHT NOW . . . . IMMEDIATELY . . . . Please !

Tell me "I am not sure either" write to me, talk to me, email me, Hurry, I am waiting for YOU !

title: Screen Writer Alliance
text:
I have a great screenplay that requires the eye of a gifted writer with industry connections. 
If this is you, I propose a collaboration. 


Gangsters Defend A Community Against Eminent Domain
TONY LANDON'S
NIC'S DIMES & SENSE

An edgy screenplay bound to explode onto the movie scene based upon the premise
"There's A Right Way To Do A Wrong Thing"

In 2018 construction begins on The Warner Washington Tollway. A hundred mile stretch of highway originating in the Fourth District that connects Washington D.C with two Interstate Systems just south of Petersburg Va. An expansion that changes the commute of the millions of riders who use the Toll Way and the lives of the people all around it. 

Our story begins long before the morning Kim exits the Honda in the Balmart parking lot. For her it started in the tracks of her mother's daily injections. A nasty "Speed Ball" that set in motion a chain of events resulting in her very own Eighty Dollar a day Heroin habit. An addiction she and Bug means to facilitate by any means necessary. 

Devices foreseen by Tiffany Mckinzie and passed on to her Balmart staff but to no avail. See! Kim's a dope fiend and the girl's gotta have it. Valentine knows this and has every intention of ensuring that the second Kim sells the thousand dollars worth of inventory she's about to steal from Balmart that he has available to her "China White", the best dope in Richmond. That's why he's in N.Y. 
Buy the best dope at the cheapest price and sell it for less. In no time at all, he'd be a millionaire.

Linwood Brown and his brothers don't see it that way. They control the lucrative Richmond drug market and a host of killers to enforce their will. He admired the gall of the New York and Philadelphia drug dealers who came to Richmond to apply their trade. He'd let them build up a respectable amount of cash before he killed them. As always, an amount worth his time.

None of this escaped the watchful eye of Tuna and in accordance to code he warns a determined Yakoo and Valentine about their ambitious plan.


A plan that didn't include meeting and falling in love with the voluptuous Ricca Sanchez. 
The day they walk into her brothel, she had no way of knowing their entwined destiny. 
It wasn't just her heart that brought her to Richmond. She was on a mission. 

A mission that would pit her against gangsters, corrupt politicians and ruthless Billionaire Charlie Warner. A man not accustomed to taking "No" for an answer. That includes his daily pursuit of sexy secretary Nina Johnson. Even the Police Commissioner was subject to the whelms of Warner Billups. He turns a blind eye on the money bought gangsters imported on Charlie's behalf. Of course none of this would have mattered if Tuna didn't have a plan of his own and Estelle Jacobs, a pillar of her community, hadn't been so self righteous. Emerson Parks warned her that she should take the money and run. That's what he did and he took the young and impressionable Jamekia Jackson with him.



That didn't sit well with his wife, the refined Sherri Parks and she confessed the same to Rev. Adare just before she's ravished.

It was almost too much for Craig Martin to fathom. Neither his MIT education nor his military training prepared him for the ruthlessness of Lagan Holmes. A born killer who takes particular pride in his work. Confused? So were Richmond Detectives Hobo and Jesus when the bodies started showing up.

They figured Gray had something to do with it but he'd disappeared. Don't blame them though. No one could have imagined that this many powerful people would have so much vested in a small neighborhood far from them all. In the end, it's a matter of Nics, Dimes & Sense that won't be resolved until the final pages of this twisted story of not so good versus evil reaches its climactic resolve. 

NIC'S DIMES & SENSE
"A GANGSTA STORY"


This document is protected under the copyright laws of the United States.
No part of Nics, Dimes & Sense may be reproduced in any manner without the express written consent of the copyright owner 2008.



If you're interested in knowing more about NDS then send me your contact information along with your ideas of what is to be next. I'd love hearing from you. Until then, take care and all the best to your family.

title: A little frustrated in life, need some advice
text: Ok, so posting this from way up north, i live in Fairbanks, Alaska. I need some advice in life. So first off this entire chain of events started about 2 months ago. I ran into some technical difficulties with my phone, to where, A, I ran out of data, and B, I have an odd problem up here to where the phone with not function at temperatures positive 4 degrees Fahrenheit or below. I realize that's not a problem you guys have in Texas. But I do. The second thing that happened right in the same time frame, is that my laptop decided to go wanky. So I had to exchange phones, upgrade the laptop, and during that time I backed off of Facebook. Now how i post is 90% where friends only can see it, and I have posted my phone number numerous times. I figured that if somebody worried, or if needed to contact me if that if I was not on Facebook, that they can just give me a call. I work as a commercial driver up here, I cannot always be to looking at my phone. I'm on the road I do not look at my phone at all, in fact I tell people don't text to me because I can't read what you said until I get off road, and it's not quite like Texas where you have towns every few miles. We have to towns every hundred miles. Then were this really starts coming into play, is that I've always said that my quote friends unquote or more like family. Well, of about 90 people on my friends list, in over 2 months, only one person has called, and it was once. Nobody's tried swing by where I live, which most people know, nor have they made the attempt to swing by my work, which is quite well known where I work. Now, in cities and in states in the lower 48, where you have more people and guess who would be easier, but we don't have a lot of people. Fairbanks is not that big, and i am quite often in smaller towns, that are maybe 5, 10, 15 people. In the distance between those towns, can be hundreds of miles. The next thing that makes this a lot more difficult to then with you guys deal with in Texas, is for the fact that we are still in our winter. Now, what that means is that are night time, is about 12 hours now, when this first began that night was 16 hours. That's a lot of darkness. That is a lot of darkness. And even with hobbies, work, things that need to be done, you take that length of nights, compound that with no people that you have in contact with, and being slightly on the depressed side. No I'm not planning on doing anything stupid, I actually enjoy what I do, but I'm really fighting with my mind and loneliness. Of the final factor to the equation, where I've been single for more than 2 years, still greatly missing the person that I loved when I was young, and I'm 34, and I think you can see where I'm going. I'm beyond frustrated. Now I guess the final piece of this equation, is the hours that we work. Here in Alaska, a commercial driver is allowed 80 hours in a rolling 7 day day time frame, that's it a lot of hours, in very little time to try to find someone to conversate with. I don't know what to do anymore. I need some advice. As far as Facebook I have not posted my frustration, I have not let anybody know the reason why I did the final piece of the back off. It became a test, of people are so this darn connected with this electronic society. Which it looks like they are. To where they cannot even pick up the phone dial 7 numbers, and call somebody. Yes Alaska small enough we do have seven digit dialing. So I'm asking, if you were to even be in a semi similar boat, how would you approach and what would you do. Again I'm not thinking of doing anything stupid, I'm trying to remain positive. But that honestly is becoming harder and harder. Can somebody give me some advice. Thanks. Sign, a friend on the road.

title: Give & Take - Hear me out.
text:
Hello Seekers,

I have chosen my words carefully in the title of my posting to succinctly convey what I am seeking and have to offer. Apart from the dictionary meaning, context is important and hence thought to elaborate to give you insight about the person behind this ad. I happened to read a book titled "Give & Take: Why helping others drives our Success", which resonated with me and is written more in a professional business context. But given where I am at this point my life's journey could have applied to my personal life and the context of my ad.

I am a 38 yr old married educated professional, blessed in many ways but not the one that matters the most; emotional connection. I can share the why and how but have come to realize it's not important to dwell but see if I change it. World is a kaleidoscope of good and bad life situations and experiences. I have been blessed in life and worked hard to gain career and material success and appreciate the struggles folks go thru and the book I referred to earlier suggests a course forward. Put simply I am seeking a good person where friendship can blossom, assuming chemistry, interests and personalities align to fill the void of an emotional connection. In return below are aspects of genuine friendship I have to offer. This Give & Take I hope is a reasonable proposition for what I seek and have to offer.

Generous: Time, Material, Monetary, Altruistic
Gent: Refined, Chivalry, Adventurous, Respectful
Platonic: Non-carnal, Intellectual, Emotional, Connection
Friend: Emotional, Connection, Empathy, Boundaries

As this is an introductory email, I will refrain from the usual descriptions of life interests, hobbies etc which can be discussed if first there is a meeting of the minds. Thanks for reading and if you would like chat or explore more drop me an email.
Till then. . ..

title: Drive For Our Bike Ride, Cross the USA for Free!
text:
I didn't know where to post this because we are looking for something different, as you will see. I listed a zip code because Craigslist required it.

We are two bicycle riders who plan on riding across the USA, from San Francisco to St. Petersburg, Florida, starting in June 2016 and ending mid to late August. (Yes, we know it will be HOT, but that it is when drivers are most likely available.)

We are looking for a c0-driver for a support vehicle (we already have a local 29 year old woman and she would like some company along the way) We will pay your travel, lodging, entertainment and food expenses during the trip. 

You will arrive in the San Francisco Bay Area where we are and we will drive to Los Angeles a few days before the June 14 start of our bike ride so that you can do some seeing there. In Los Angeles you will experience such sights as the Pacific Ocean, Venice Beach (a uniquely California experience), Korea Town, Hollywood and Beverly Hills. We then ride towards Palm Springs and on to the Grand Canyon (a wonder of the world and photos really do not do it justice). From there we will travel through such places as Flagstaff and Sedona, Arizona, Albuquerque, New Mexico (with its Native American culture), Santa Fe (one of the art capitals of the world), Carlsbad Caverns, Austin (probably the most progressive city in Texas), San Antonio (home of the Alamo and its river walk which doesn't rival Venice but is nonetheless fun), Baton Rouge, New Orleans (home of Cajun cooking and Mardi Gras) and finally St. Augustine (the oldest continuously occupied European settlement in the US). We will spend rest and visiting days in the more interesting places so it won't be just a "drive by" experience.

There will be boring stretches of vast expanses, but more importantly, you will have the chance to see more small town "Americana" than most Americans get to see while experiencing Tex-Mex food, parts of the "Old West," Louisiana, Florida and much more. We will take a different route driving back across the country to see different places, probably including Las Vegas. When we return to the San Francisco Bay Area you will get to see, of course, the Golden Gate Bridge, it's beautiful views, Sausalito, the Berkeley campus, and more if you want. 

Because the two of us will be riding our bikes going to Florida, your driving will only be from 100km to at most 200km (60 to, at the most, 115 miles) per day, with some days off for our rest and to visit places of interest. We would like you to do laundry once a week or so while we are riding as well as some food shopping and preparation (lunches, such as sandwiches) and help with planning our lodging and stops.

You need to be good natured, responsible, easy to get along with, speak English, have a valid driver's license and be able to get a visa to visit the USA if a visa is required. This is perfect for a college student, a recent graduate who doesn't yet have a job or possibly a teacher who wants to spend vacation time exploring.

In the photo, I am 2nd from the right and Nick is 4th from the right. 

We are 2 responsible professional men who live near San Francisco.

Let us know if you are interested.

Thank you, and here is to the adventure of a life time,

Rick

Lately. instead of buying teeth , I bought solar panels and a wind turbine. I live on land in SE Oklahoma, it's beautiful and i have been here too long. They say, i am bipolar and very creative. I was there for over a week and learned alot about people and more about myself. I have been living in this remote area for so long and no one really talks or thinks or they are like me total loners. 

I am 53 and going to say like others, oh, but i look much younger and i do and i have to explain that i am even a grandpa of 4 . I have eaten well and have decent genes, trashed myself here and there but so far keep getting up. 

I believe i know a lot about life and the world. I do not really work and have had time to study. I would like to read actually books as I age . I am very different from most of the men you have met.

I have a lot of natural trend-noticing and high observational skills. I have good instincts and I operate on logic and reason, not emotions. With the right person's brain to pick, I think I could develop some competency in trading. In return, I would be happy to coach you on all things cards and sports-info related. If you're someone who actually wants to try and win when you play poker and sportsbet, and find those tiny advantages and small edges, I am that person. I don't gamble, I play are skill games. Games where statistics, recent history, trends, psychology, weather, indicators, and to a degree, luck, all play a factor in the outcome or result. Sounds a lot like stocks huh? I have a deep understanding of poker, on the psychological and subconscious levels. I can tell you why players do certain things that they don't even understand why they do. Its all behavioral training and the fact most people are naturally uncomfortable lying, and in poker, lying (bluffing) is mandatory. Anyway, point is, I think we could have more than a fair trade on brainpicking if this is something that interests any stocks aficionados. This would be over skype/phone as I'm posting this in multiple cities. I am posting this in women AND men, because it doesn't matter to me. I will say however, these skills are SO much more valuable to women, but most of them don't realize it. Put your city in the line so I know you read the whole thing. Not interested in answering questions I already covered. Not interested in "tell me more". Not interested in people who started trading 3 months ago and are up 500 bucks. Thanks, all.

title: Underwear Review
text:
Hey guys! It's been a couple of weeks since my last review....I'm running out of underwear to review. I need to go shopping. Thanks to all of you who have "checked in" on me this week. I haven't fallen of the face of the earth...just busier than I've ever been. I've taken on a position in our city government, but it's all good.
This weeks review I'm super excited about, Duluth Trading's 'Buck Naked' underwear. Now if the name doesn't make you want to order a pair, then hopefully my review will.
Duluth Trading has done a good job in their advertising, targeting their brand to the average 'bear looking' guy. Then the ads all stopped and people like me turn to their website which leaves a trail of cookies right back to our computers. In my opinion, that's good advertising.
So yes, I ordered a pair and I'm so glad I did. The fabric is a honeycomb weave nylon. Now Usually don't like a fabric without at least some percentage of cotton, nylon gives me a rash or at the very least makes me feel like I'm scratching my balls off. But with this unusual weave makes them as comfortable as cotton. Their claim is "no sweat, no stink, no pinch" and they are true to their claim. When I got mine in the mail I immediately put them on and wore them the rest of that day, wore them to bed that night. Then decided to wear them the following day and night. And they are true to their claim.....they felt and smelled clean enough the wear them again the next day (but I didn't).
The construction is top notch....double and 3 needle sewing. The style is somewhat old man looking, but the real treat to these u/w is the gusset through the crotch area. A double layer of fabric sewn in across the crotch. This causes a gentle lift the the balls without forcing them into a pouch. I just bought myself a truck ..... I have to lift myself up into the seat and if I'm not careful my balls will get under a leg and I end up sitting on them, even with a pouch. Buck Naked keeps everyting in place.
I only have two things against these U/W, one being the "old man" style and the other is that the rise is just a bit too high. Now I don't like low rise, but I don't want them up to my belly button either.
I HIGHLY recommend this brand....I think you guys will like them too.
A shout out to George .... I haven't got to talk to you in a while...but I think about you every day.
I love talking to all of you...keep the feedback coming.
I love you and there ain't nothing you can do about it.

title: People of craigslist
text:
Hello craislist folk old and new.
I have some personal stuff to say... Which is why im posting this to the personals.
Well its not really a life story but then again it kind've is. Im just looking for some perspective. 

I'm that girl who was over protected by parents and siblings. Never really knew what the world was like or about other people outside of the main fam. We were altogether an island.

So long story as short as I can make it... I went to live at the dorms for college as a requirement. I ended meeting this mormon guy who seemed nice (by my very small understanding of humans outside of the fam. My parents ended up disowning because i started dating this guy. I freaked out when this happend and after a year of mourning my folks (the only humans i had ever been close to) I agreed to marry the guy.

Yet after marrying the dude.. Turned out he has some major problems... Problems that cause him to constantly go back on his commitments. He just throws out the word divorce like its just something normal to say. And as I grow to understand myself, I'm feeling that i won't be able to take this much drama for much longer. 

But then theres this other part of me that is so afraid to have another failed relationship on my belt. I mean what would this mean for me as a person? The only two close relationshops i have ever had are parents and this man... No friends or anything. I never even had a boyfriend before this guy because i was not allowed to date. Am i doomed as a person? Or is there a hope that you can see that I just simply cannot?

title: Seeking an intelligent, engaging coffee/lunch friend
text: Yes I am married, but that doesn't mean that I shouldn't be able to meet new people and make new friends. This is not a veiled attempt at initiating any type of extra-marital fling but, rather, is simply emblematic of my need for a new outlet because, as horrible as it sounds, the whole family-life-thing can just suck the life out of you at times to the point where you no longer remember who you are as an individual (and please, I don't want to hear any grief about that statement because we have all been there at one time or another). Despite that dismal assessment of the status quo, I wouldn't give it up for the world and am not looking to change anything. It is simply that the "play-dates" for the kids aren't cutting it any more as far as social interaction and I can only spend so much time with my co-workers, and even my wife and I hardly have a minute to ourselves. Our conversations have devolved to the point where we don't talk about much else other than the kids and by the time they are in bed at night and we can relax we are just too tired to talk about anything meaningful. This doesn't mean that our marriage is bad, it just means that we are frazzled parents who devote all of our time and energy to the children without regard for our own lives. Most of the people with whom I work are single and much younger than I am, and I really don't want to spend a lunch hour hearing about their drunken exploits. I prefer to meet a woman simply because I have always gotten along better with women and can find more common ground. I am not one of those guys who can only talk about sports or sex and I am also not at the other extreme like a metro-sexual...I am just somewhere in between. I miss talking about current events, politics, a good book, life in general...

title: Are you married and missing something?

It would be nice to find someone to share a quality, emotional, and passionate friendship with, but how does that start on the internet? It seems almost impossible to weed through it all and find someone who matches your desires. The anonymity of posting here is appealing, but there also needs to be caution.

I am an educated, career-oriented professional, who is reasonably fit and handsome. I have a fairly sarcastic sense of humor bordering on irreverence. I am pretty comfortable with who and what I am. I would also like to find someone who is smart, honest, fun, humorous, sexy and not afraid to share. You should also be mature enough to know that this does not lead to someone leaving their marriage, but can be maintained discreetly as long as we choose. We should both simply know what we want. title: What is your cure?
text:
Curious to know how others address loneliness in their lives.

Sure there's the physical aspects, I know the audience I've chosen, but that isn't really what I mean.
I'm talking about the heart-hunger to connect with someone else with whom you feel an affinity, a sincere, mutual interest. 
Obviously, reading Craigslist ads is one of my approaches. (More of a guilty pleasure. "Did that person I made eye contact with today feel anything more?") It also has been among the least fulfilling.

Family members have suggested 'Meet ups', and I'm not opposed. Volunteering especially, seems a likely place to find people of a similar nature.

I'm not into the bar scene. I don't indulge in standard 'beautification' rituals that would have me spending time and money while someone grooms/ pampers me and gives me their attention, but to be honest, I can see the appeal. I see posts all of the time where guys have become interested in a waitress, or service professional who has assisted them. It makes me wonder, is it due to the fact that these exchanges are one of the few ways in which people have an opportunity to regard one another anymore?

In our increasingly transient, tech-based society, what is the likelihood that in a given day we have that chance to be 'in-touch' with others, in a meaningful way?

When you are new to a place, or when your social scene has changed, what are the best ways to create connection, to build community? 
I'd love for your to share your thoughts, insights, approaches, suggestions on this.
Thanks, and here's to hoping your heart is full!

title: Have you ever imagined being drawn by an artist . . .
text:
Have you ever imagined being drawn by an artist . . . but the shook off the delicious thought as a foolish dream? . . . have you imagined watching the artist's eyes, attentive, fascinated . . . tracing your form, while his charcoal or pencil or paintbrush moves across the paper . . . moves across the canvas?

And then, as he takes a break . . . and you stretch to recover from holding still . . . step around to peer at the surface . . . that was once boring and white . . . and you see the fullness of you rendered in loving detail . . .

And you have an epiphany moment (!) . . . you actually . . . are . . . a work of art . . . beautiful . . . sensitively placed on the canvas . . . carefully traced onto paper . . . perhaps even later . . . emerge as a statue in clay . . .

Write . . . send a picture even . . . to see how you look in charcoal . . . an image of beauty . . .

title: Married Cub seeking Married Cougar
text:
Like the title suggest I am a married cub looking for a married cougar. 

And here is what I'm looking for. I want to be able to come to my phone between breaks and find an email waiting. I want to be able to just shoot the breeze with you, talk about life, current events, share my heart, and read as you share yours. I want a friend, someone who has time to email throughout the day and hopefully chat in the evening. Someone who understands that if I have a busy day with work that I might be slow on the replies. I don't want any pressure--I want a friendly, uncomplicated, fun friendship. I want to feel young and handsome and desired. I want to sit down here at my desk throughout the day and when I see your email, I feel like I'm on vacation. I want more than one or two lines. I want someone with whom I can be honest. I want us to be able to share everything about our days, about our lives, our feelings, what made us smile, what made us irritated. All of it! I want our emails to be like sitting across the table in a restaurant, sharing an order of fries and just talking about everything and nothing or snuggled in bed. I want to connect. If we hit it off we can see what happens from there.

About me, if it matters to you: I'm 35 and atheletic, wicked sense of humor, easy going, able to let most of the stress of life slide off me. I love doing things for others. I hate getting up early but I do everyday. I'm a night owl. I'm disorganized and messy, which drives me nuts, but I have a system in my mess that works for me. I love being active and outdoors. I like to run and swim and bike and also do yogs. I love animals and have a kind heart. I enjoy going to eat and love a hot cup of coffee. I recharge in solitude, and most of the time I'm sorely in need of some recharging. 

About you: I would prefer you to be a white collar career oriented woman. I am turned on by intelligence and wit. I am also looking for someone significantly older than me. I admit I have a bit of a oedipus complex. So being a mother is a huge plus to me.

title: A Platonic experiment?

These women's standards are very exacting though. In any case, here is a married male who is interested in experimenting with the possibility of a platonic relationship with another female. title: Do married women read 'Strictly Platonic' posts?

I'm the handsome married-guy-next door type, that exercises and takes care of himself, and I'm looking for that selective, ultra-discrete, emotionally secure Mom that I see and smile at when going to our kids games or grocery shopping. Trying to be very discrete myself, I'm not sure how to approach such a woman and not risk unfortunate consequences. So here I am, posting amongst the college kids and web-cam professionals.

Neither of us is looking for a permanent escape from our married lives. We are both actually happy/content in many ways in our married lives, yet miss the communication, the flirting and the sensual attention and appreciation from the opposite sex. We both have busy, active lives, and understand the importance of family, and while we can enjoy ourselves together, our fun times will always take a back seat to maintaining our real world lives.

title: Your cure
text:
The lonely hearts club has many members, unbeknownst to most of the other members. This is what I have determined.

I thank you for your responses, many heart-felt and thoughtful. I was overwhelmed by them, in number and in depth. I only hope I can honor you by doing justice to the summary of the feedback you considerately put forth.

That being said, I did get a handful of responses that clearly did not give a single consideration beyond the physical. One person even saw fit to send a message that said, in its entirety, "f--- you". Why even bother? I can only guess that a chord was struck.
Nice to note that for most of you, what resonated was much lovelier, if to a melancholy tune. 

Now, are you ready to read-on about my 'lack of relationship heart-ache' to distract you momentarily from the 'what is/isn't going on in my relationship drama'? From what I've read, you are. Take heart, you're in luck!

Several of you wisely noted that for loneliness, there is no cure, only therapy.
On this subject, dear ones, we are widely versed! 
Favorite ways to combat the symptoms of loneliness included volunteerism, exercise, taking up a class, making a change in employment to something that gave greater opportunity to interact with others, exploring a hobby, and attending cultural events.
The basic idea is one I am eager to continue embracing, GO OUT! DO things that interest you. Learn what gives you joy and find it, cultivate it, share it with others, etc.

A curious practice cited by many, both sheepishly and unabashedly, was 'friends with benefits'. I can see pros and cons to this practice. On the plus side, yes, it fills the temporary need for physical contact. Sometimes, that is all that people are looking for.
On the downside, it is, by nature, a temporary arrangement. If you know yourself well enough to know that you ultimately desire to form a lasting, loving relationship, such a practice can quickly begin to feel hollow, perpetuating what I can only imagine as a cycle of temporary arrangements that inevitably disappoint. 
To give an honest assessment, the practice sounds rather collegiate, or like 're-bounding'. 
Still, I get it that people are wired differently and that they have different goals for their personal and relational selves at different stages of life. 

I found it interesting to note that most people won't say 'no' if physical contact is offered/ available, but many also cite that what really draws them to a person is that person's manner/ ability to connect via conversation. If you've read about Love Languages, perhaps you had a similar question as that which came to my mind, that it likely depends on the person. I would also guess that another factor is which needs of yours have been met, or gone unmet over a length of time. 

For me, reading about what people content themselves with was very motivating to clearly and openly communicate my desire for something deeper (when the opportunity presents itself), and to recognize that a lasting love likely comes at the price of greater risk. We must at times allow ourselves to be vulnerable to heart-ache and break, to embrace these feelings as part of a process that strengthens us in preparation for a relationship worthy of our hard work, open-hearts, and participation.

You are a gift. Your kind, caring, encouraging thoughts and words are treasures. Not everyone will value them equally. Make sure that you do.
You may not fully understand your value to the right person, but never doubt for a second that you are WORTHY. 

I remember my mom telling me when I was little, for anyone to love you, you must first love yourself. She's a good mom. It has taken me many years and much heartache to live the wisdom she attempted to impart to me.
I hope I can do justice to her intentions for me as I continue to try to become established in this new place, so that soon, it will feel more like 'home'.
I know that I need to be patient with myself, allow time to adjust as I explore my surroundings, and discover how I can meaningfully contribute to this new community.

Thank you, kind neighbors and potential friends, for sharing your stories and sentiments with me. I hope you will keep an eye out at your local bookstore/ library, the Farmer's market/ garden store, the group dance classes, and cultural events for the girl on her own. Compliment her, or the event, if that's your style, but to really catch her eye, and maybe her heart, ask her for her opinion, her thoughts, or her feelings. Interested is interesting. There's my tip for you!

Feel free to share more of yours with me! Which are the best gyms around town? Which schools/ businesses offer professional/ personal development classes? Which parks have the nicest trails? What local festivals/ events should I add to my calendar? And for goodness sake, where does a girl have to go to find some stellar Froyo!? ;) 
Thanks and may you find gold at the end of all your rainbows!

title: Need an active/fit mentor
text:
I'm ashamed but have to admit that I have really let myself go over the years. I have tried to become healthier and more active, but bad habits and a sedentary lifestyle has severely weakened my will power. I need a mentor/friend to help me change this.

I know "that only I can really make the difference/decision to change" and normally I would agree with this statement as I follow it with almost everything else in my life, but for some reason this one plagues me. I really need help, not just motivation.

I need someone that can show me good habits and be there to enforce them. Someone that is currently active, fit and around my age. I have tried with family members and other friends, but they just do not understand that I need this to be a complete lifestyle change with daily interaction and accountability.

To not only show me how to eat better and what to buy, but also how much to buy. Often I will buy all this great stuff and then just get overwhelmed and then let it rot in the fridge because fast food is easier. I need someone that can push me physically and just get out of the house. Hell, I'd even be willing to pay for this kind of daily help.

I know to some this may sound pathetic and in a way I guess it is. But that's why I'm here asking for help and if you cannot get past that, please just move on. I do not need or want your pity, sarcasm or judgmental remarks. You don't know my story or how I really got this way. Your emails will literally just be ignored and deleted so don't waste your time or mine.

For those who are serious, you'll recognize that this is really just a cry for help. Please send an example of what you would expect our mentor/student/friendship to look like (i.e. routines, meals, activity, etc.) and pictures of you doing activities you really enjoy (I've always wanted to be comfortable to take pictures doing things I love, but always feel too self conscience) so I know you're the kind of person I would want to spend my time with.

I do not know how long this will take or last, but I do that I cannot do this on my own right now. Seriously, please help.

title: Lets have a little chit chat.
text:
It is a Wednesday evening, and I have an abnormal amount of free time available to myself and thought I would see if I could discover anyone new. Finding out about people (making the introductions, asking the initial questions, discovering if you have anything in common or not) is my favorite part. It doesn't always (or often) work out and turn into an extensive or long term friendship, but when it does it is usually pretty good.

I've had some seriously funny experiences with posting ads on this site, which is why I suppose I haven't entirely ventured away despite the experiences that were not nearly as enjoyable. So here I am, after a couple years of staying abstinent from random emails, giving in to temptation and trying again. 

We can goof off and email each other back and forth till one of us gets bored. Perhaps if we are really lucky we can meet. Either way, let's entertain ourselves with no pressure and have a good time.

I am not looking for anything romantic, so please don't try. Provide some info about yourself so we can have a topic for conversation to start. Put your favorite vegetable in the subject line if you want your email to be read.

title: A married man seeks levity with a married woman

I'm a college educated, degreed professional with a vigor for life and a great attitude, in general. I'm an easy going, down to earth, fun to be around and love to laugh and make others around me laugh. I love conversing about things cerebral, and even more so about things silly and goofy.

title: Are you a married professional who can relate?
text:
Does this sound like you?

1) You are married, but not in an ideal relationship; you rarely have intimacy, you feel like taken for granted, but for reasons only another married person would understand, you would not think of leaving.

2) You are classy, attractive and mature - just reading these ads is exciting to you. Responding to any of these makes you feel very nervous, but what is a person supposed to do? No way you'd make a pass at the attractive neighbor next door - you take care of yourself, making an attempt to always look your best, you eat right, exercise and don't smoke. 

3) You are an active and busy person, who is involved and interested in the world around you - your family demands a lot from you, and you enjoy that role for the most part. 

In spite of all this, you are missing something in your life - a friend, an individual who is non judgmental- a person with whom you can be silly, laugh, flirt and just have fun without having to worry about anything and have a liberating avenue for yourself. This essentially explains my situation, and the reason I am seeking a woman in a similar place in her life.

If you think you are emotionally stable and grounded enough to handle a discreet friendship, and are able to separate or compartmentalize your real life from such a friendship, please write me back with a little bit about yourself and we can go from there. Please be creative with your subject line, and write more than couple of sentences so that I know you are for real, and serious about developing a meaningful friendship.

Despite that dismal assessment of the status quo, I wouldn't give it up for the world and am not looking to change anything. It is simply that the "play-dates" for the kids aren't cutting it any more as far as social interaction and I can only spend so much time with my co-workers, and even my wife and I hardly have a minute to ourselves. Our conversations have devolved to the point where we don't talk about much else other than the kids and by the time they are in bed at night and we can relax we are just too tired to talk about anything meaningful. This doesn't mean that our marriage is bad, it just means that we are frazzled parents who devote all of our time and energy to the children without regard for our own lives. Most of the people with whom I work are single and much younger than I am, and I really don't want to spend a lunch hour hearing about their drunken exploits. I prefer to meet a woman simply because I have always gotten along better with women and can find more common ground. I am not one of those guys who can only talk about sports or sex and I am also not at the other extreme like a metro-sexual...I am just somewhere in between. title: Are you married and missing something?
text:
What do we really think we can find here on CL? Do we think we will fill the needs that we have? Is it just a fantasy? Is it the lust that is not in our marriages anymore? I am honestly not entirely sure what I expect to find here on CL. It would be nice to find someone to share a quality, emotional, and passionate friendship with, but how does that start on the internet? It seems almost impossible to weed through it all and find someone who matches your desires. The anonymity of posting here is appealing, but there also needs to be caution. 

I do not want to leave my marriage, but I still can't stop feeling the need for passion, lust, sex, physical and mental contact. What do you want? 

I am an educated, career-oriented professional, who is reasonably fit and handsome. I have a fairly sarcastic sense of humor bordering on irreverence. I am pretty comfortable with who and what I am. I am happy in my life. I like to be direct at times. Sometimes I am serious and sometimes I just like to laugh. 

I want to experience passion with a woman again. I want to lust after you and for you to lust after me. I want to daydream about you, the smell of your hair, the sparkle in your eyes, the taste of you, the feel of you, the warmth of your body. 

While this is something I would not base solely on looks, I think there should be a match between both people. I would like to find someone similar to myself who is athletic, slim and attractive. I would also like to find someone who is smart, honest, fun, humorous, sexy and not afraid to share. You should also be mature enough to know that this does not lead to someone leaving their marriage, but can be maintained discreetly as long as we choose. We should both simply know what we want. We are looking for a connection that breeds desire. We want to feel lusted after. 

So there is my post and maybe there is a woman out there who is married and feels the same as I do. Maybe this will appeal to you. Maybe you will take a chance and reply to me. So how do we go about doing this?

title: What is your cure?
text:
Curious to know how others address loneliness in their lives.

Sure there's the physical aspects, I know the audience I've chosen, but that isn't really what I mean.
I'm talking about the heart-hunger to connect with someone else with whom you feel an affinity, a sincere, mutual interest. 
Obviously, reading Craigslist ads is one of my approaches. (More of a guilty pleasure. "Did that person I made eye contact with today feel anything more?") It also has been among the least fulfilling.

Family members have suggested 'Meet ups', and I'm not opposed. Volunteering especially, seems a likely place to find people of a similar nature.

I'm not into the bar scene. I don't indulge in standard 'beautification' rituals that would have me spending time and money while someone grooms/ pampers me and gives me their attention, but to be honest, I can see the appeal. I see posts all of the time where guys have become interested in a waitress, or service professional who has assisted them. It makes me wonder, is it due to the fact that these exchanges are one of the few ways in which people have an opportunity to regard one another anymore?

In our increasingly transient, tech-based society, what is the likelihood that in a given day we have that chance to be 'in-touch' with others, in a meaningful way?

When you are new to a place, or when your social scene has changed, what are the best ways to create connection, to build community? 
I'd love for your to share your thoughts, insights, approaches, suggestions on this.
Thanks, and here's to hoping your heart is full!

title: Gym partner
text:
Currently, I'm going to the JustFitness4U off Old Denton Rd. in Carrollton 3 nights a week. I've been going with a friend, but his consistent cancellations are beginning to irritate me to no end, so I need someone who I can partner with that is reliable. Every now and then it happens, I understand, but it shouldn't be the kind of thing you come to worry about every week.

So more specifically, I'm looking for someone who is maybe looking to liven up their workouts with someone to help with spotting, chit-chat, etc. I work out in the evening, typically arriving around 8:30, but there can be slight modifications if need be to better fit your schedule. On bench, I'm putting up 245 for 6 reps (my heaviest that I've gone) as well as curling 55-60 lbs dumbbells, at heaviest. I also do chinups and pullups (unassisted). title: Have you ever imagined being drawn by an artist . . .
text:
Have you ever imagined being drawn by an artist . . . but then shook off the delicious thought as a foolish dream? . . . have you imagined watching the artist's eyes, attentive, fascinated . . . tracing your form, while his charcoal or pencil or paintbrush moves across the paper . . . moves across the canvas?

And then, as he takes a break . . . and you stretch to recover from holding still . . . step around to peer at the surface . . . that was once boring and white . . . and you see the fullness of you rendered in loving detail . . .

And you have an epiphany moment (!) . . . you actually . . . are . . . a work of art . . . beautiful . . . sensitively placed on the canvas . . . carefully traced onto paper . . . perhaps even later . . . emerge as a statue in clay . . .

Write . . . send a picture even . . . to see how you look in charcoal . . . an image of beauty . . .

title: Need a Date for a Party? Event? New in Town? Or Just Bored?
text:
Hi. No. This isn't a joke. I'm a real guy. After hearing many of my friends and peers bemoaning the fact that they didn't have dates, boyfriends, etc. for the upcoming parties and events, I decided to put myself out there. Of course, already being friends, I didn't approach them about offering to take them out, but nonetheless I thought it might be a good, fun and intriguing idea that would make everyone happy.What does Rent-A-Gent do? I will be happy to accompany you to a party, event, night on the town, casual date or just sightseeing if you're new in town or just bored. I can pick you up or meet you there. You decide.Who is Rent-A-Gent and what might make him interesting or intriguing to you?
I am a 48-year-old caucasian straight male who is divorced
I am 6 foot 6 and weigh around 235 pounds
I have no facial hair, tats or piercings
I've been told I'm both imposing and approachable at the same time - probably because I have big shoulders, but also have a quick, easy smile and look like the guy-next-door
I have a Master's Degree
I can speak easily about virtually any subject - from politics to history to philosophy to sports
I won't get slobbery drunk and embarrass you in front of everyone
If we went to a party or an event, I would actually speak to your friends and 'mingle' instead of sitting sullenly by myself at the table
As a date, I can be as detached (just a friend) or as cozy to you as you wish me to
I will wear cologne - but not too much and it won't be AquaVelva
I won't try to make an unsolicited pass at you that would make things awkward
I would notice if you wore something new or changed cut/color of your hair
I'm as comfortable in a dive bar as I am in an Art Museum
I listen. I also talk, but I don't dominate the conversation. And I actually talk about the things you're interested in - which probably ISN'T Hunting, Fantasy Football or WWE. But hey, if you do like those things, I can talk about them as well
I'd like to think I have a great sense of humor which can range from silly and goofy to punny to dry and satirical
I can behave like a responsible adult or a carefree and spontaneous partner in crime
I drive a nice, new car so if I did pick you up, you wouldn't show up in a clunker
I don't wear tuxedos though. It just isn't my thing
Interested? Intrigued? Drop me a line and let's see if we can make our schedules fit.

title: Drive For Our Bike Ride, Cross the USA for Free!
text:
I didn't know where to post this because we are looking for something different, as you will see. I listed a zip code because Craigslist required it.

We are two bicycle riders who plan on riding across the USA, from San Francisco to St. Petersburg, Florida, starting in June 2016 and ending mid to late August. (Yes, we know it will be HOT, but that it is when drivers are most likely available.)

We are looking for a c0-driver for a support vehicle (we already have a local 29 year old woman and she would like some company along the way) We will pay your travel, lodging, entertainment and food expenses during the trip. 

You will arrive in the San Francisco Bay Area where we are and we will drive to Los Angeles a few days before the June 14 start of our bike ride so that you can do some seeing there. In Los Angeles you will experience such sights as the Pacific Ocean, Venice Beach (a uniquely California experience), Korea Town, Hollywood and Beverly Hills. We then ride towards Palm Springs and on to the Grand Canyon (a wonder of the world and photos really do not do it justice). From there we will travel through such places as Flagstaff and Sedona, Arizona, Albuquerque, New Mexico (with its Native American culture), Santa Fe (one of the art capitals of the world), Carlsbad Caverns, Austin (probably the most progressive city in Texas), San Antonio (home of the Alamo and its river walk which doesn't rival Venice but is nonetheless fun), Baton Rouge, New Orleans (home of Cajun cooking and Mardi Gras) and finally St. Augustine (the oldest continuously occupied European settlement in the US). We will spend rest and visiting days in the more interesting places so it won't be just a "drive by" experience.

There will be boring stretches of vast expanses, but more importantly, you will have the chance to see more small town "Americana" than most Americans get to see while experiencing Tex-Mex food, parts of the "Old West," Louisiana, Florida and much more. We will take a different route driving back across the country to see different places, probably including Las Vegas. When we return to the San Francisco Bay Area you will get to see, of course, the Golden Gate Bridge, it's beautiful views, Sausalito, the Berkeley campus, and more if you want. 

Because the two of us will be riding our bikes going to Florida, your driving will only be from 100km to at most 200km (60 to, at the most, 115 miles) per day, with some days off for our rest and to visit places of interest. We would like you to do laundry once a week or so while we are riding as well as some food shopping and preparation (lunches, such as sandwiches) and help with planning our lodging and stops.

You need to be good natured, responsible, easy to get along with, speak English, have a valid driver's license and be able to get a visa to visit the USA if a visa is required.
